Text

﻿Forest

ofaThousand [Daemons A Hunter]145-daemons a hunter 's Saga

byD. O. FatjumvaM.B.E.

Being a translation of

[Ogboju OdeNinu Igbo Irunmale]49-ogboju odeninu igbo irunmale

byWOLESOYINKA

Illustrated by [Bruce]50-bruce [Onabrakpeya

Random House NewYork]1-onabrakpeya random house newyork

Copyright © 1982 by [Wole Soyinka]2-wole soyinka

All rights reserved under International and Pan - American Copyright Conventions .

Published in [the United States]3-the united states by [Random House]4-random house . Inc .. [New York]5-new york and simultane-

ously in [Canada]6-canada by [Random House]4-random house ofCanada Limited . [Toronto]8-toronto . This translation

originallv published in Great [Britain]9-britain by [Thomas Nelson]51-thomas nelson and [Sons . Ltd. , [Surrey]11-surrey .

Library ofCongress Cataloging in Publication Data

[Fagunwa]52-fagunwa . DO . [Forest ofa Thousand Daemons]13-forest ofa thousand daemons]10-sons . ltd. , surrey . library ofcongress cataloging in publication data fagunwa . do . forest ofa thousand daemons . Translation of : [Ogboju ode ninu igbo irunmale

I. [Soyinka]15-soyinka . [Wole]16-wole]14-ogboju ode ninu igbo irunmale i. soyinka . wole . II . Title .

PL8824.F270313 1983 823 8342773 ISBN 0 - 394 - 5341 1 - 5

Manufactured in [the United States]3-the united states ofAmerica 98765432 First American Edition

Translator 's Note

The pattern of choices begins quite early , right from the

title in fact . Is Irunmale to be rendered literally ' four hundred[146-a critic]

deities ' rather than in the sound and sense of '[146-a critic] a thousand '[146-a critic]

or ' a thousand and one '[146-a critic] ? Again , in one of the extracts which

[I]0-i translated for the magazine Black Orpheus , this phrase

' mo nmi ho bi agilitV which became '[0-i] [my]0-i breath came in

rapid bloats like the hawing of a toad ' aroused some protest[146-a critic]

from [a critic]146-a critic . Indeed agiliti is far from being the toad , it is

more a member of the lizard species . But then neither toad

nor lizard is the object of action or interest to [the hero Akara- ogun]147-the hero akara- ogun or [[his]147-the hero akara- ogun creator]148-his creator Fagunwa at this point of narration .

[Fagunwa]52-fagunwa 's concern is to convey the vivid sense of event ,

and [a translator]149-a translator must select equivalents for mere auxiliaries

where these serve the essential purpose better than the precise

original . In what [I]0-i mentally refer to as the ' enthusiastic '[0-i] pas-

sages of [his]52-fagunwa writing , the essence of [Fagunwa]52-fagunwa is the fusion of

sound and action . To preserve the movement and fluidity

of this association seems to be the best approach for keeping

faith with [the author]150-the author 's style and sensibility .

To go back to the first example , [I]0-i have not only discarded

the earlier ' four hundred gods '[52-fagunwa] , but now consider ' daemon '[52-fagunwa] closer in essence to imale than gods , [deities or demons]151-deities or demons . The spelling is important . [These beings who inhabit [[Fagun-]18-fagun-

wa 's world]153-fagun- wa 's world]152-these beings who inhabit fagun- wa 's world demand at all costs and by [every conceivable

translator]154-every conceivable translator 's trick to be preserved from the common or mis-

leading associations which substitutes such as demons , devils

or [gods]155-gods evoke in [the reader]156-the reader 's mind . At the same time , it is

necessary that [they]152-these beings who inhabit fagun- wa 's world transmit the reality of [their]152-these beings who inhabit fagun- wa 's world existence with

the same unquestioning impact and vitality which is conveyed

by [Fagunwa]52-fagunwa in the original .

[[Fagunwa]52-fagunwa 's beings]157-fagunwa 's beings are not only [the natural inhabitants of

[[their]157-fagunwa 's beings creator]159-their creator 's haunting - ground]158-the natural inhabitants of their creator 's haunting - ground ; in [Yoruba]53-yoruba , [they]157-fagunwa 's beings sound right

in relation to [their]157-fagunwa 's beings individual natures , and the most frustrat-

ing quality of [Fagunwa]52-fagunwa for [a translator]149-a translator is the right sound of

[his]149-a translator language . This most especially has been responsible for

[my]0-i resorting to inventive naming ceremonies for [some of [[his]149-a translator

unfamiliar beings]162-his unfamiliar beings]161-some of his unfamiliar beings . The other solution , that the names remain

in their original , is not so satisfactory , as the names no longer

possess the same non - exotic validity in a new lingual surround-

ing .

[Fagunwa]52-fagunwa 's style fluctuates , for [he]52-fagunwa is both [the enthusiastic

raconteur and pious moralist]163-the enthusiastic raconteur and pious moralist , and the battle of the inventive

imagination with [the morally guided]164-the morally guided is a constant process

in much of [his]52-fagunwa work . [His]52-fagunwa total conviction in multiple existences

within [our]165-our physical world is as much an inspiration to some of the most brilliant fiction in Yoruba writing as it is a deeply

felt urge to ' justify the ways of [God]72-god to [man]2901-man '[52-fagunwa] . The experience

of sheer delight in [his]52-fagunwa verbal adroitness is undoubtedly a

great loss in translation , but is not reason enough to limit

[Fagunwa]52-fagunwa to the readership of [Yoruba speakers]166-yoruba speakers only . As [Fagunwa]52-fagunwa [himself]52-fagunwa would have put it , ' onisango di kiriyo , o[52-fagunwa]

Voun o jo bata , ijo o gbo duru , ejika ni kotufa ya . ' * [The essen-[52-fagunwa]

tial Fagunwa]52-fagunwa , as with all truly valid literature , survives the

inhibitions of strange tongues and bashful idioms . But enough . lEnu kg la nfi pe olowo ilu.^ Let [the story - teller]167-the story - teller [himself]167-the story - teller per-

suade [us]165-our . w ~

* [The Christian convert]168-the christian convert swore never again to dance to Sango drums ; when [he]168-the christian convert heard the church organ , [his]168-the christian convert jacket soon burst at the seams .

t Good drumming requires no advertisement .

1

Glossary of Yoruba and unfamiliar words

1 Agidigbo Yoruba leisurely music

played mostly at social occa-

sions . The instruments in-

clude a resonance box with

metal strips for plucking .

2 Ado , ato Small gourds for storing

powder charms .

3 [Alagemo]55-alagemo A masquerade of the cult of

the dead .

4 Ayo A game , played with seeds

in a wooden tray .

5 [Babalawo]56-babalawo [A priest of ' ifa ']2902-a priest of ' ifa '[2902-a priest of ' ifa '] , below .

6 Bembe A drum , with a deep rum- bling resonance .

7 [Buba Yoruba]53-yoruba light smock .

8 [Dandogo Yoruba]57-dandogo yoruba dress , formal .

9 Eko Corn mealie .

10 Gangan Yoruba tonal drum , usually

with a range of an octave or

more . 1 Ghommid ( iwin , oro ) A generic term for beings

neither human nor animal

nor strictly [demi - gods]169-demi - gods , most-

ly dwellers in forests where [they]170-they live within trees . Can be brought into human sur-

roundings through incanta-

tions and charms . [The ghom- mid family]171-the ghom- mid family include — :

12 Bog - troll ( ebora ) A soot - black ghommid with

glistening skin ;

;

13 [Dewild]58-dewild ( [ewele )]172-ewele ) Close in appearance to the

gnom , below , but far more dangerous and unruly

14 Gnom ( egbere ) A close relation of [the de-

wild]173-the de- wild , above , but a little more substantial , and although

prone to tears , capable of

constituting a menace to

[humans]174-humans ; 15 [Kobold ( eseku ) A gnom , with some essence

of the dead]175-kobold ( eseku ) a gnom , with some essence of the dead ;

16 [Spirits ( anjonu , oro ) Re - incarnated spirits of the

dead]176-spirits ( anjonu , oro ) re - incarnated spirits of the dead .

17 Ifa Divination .

18 Kijipa Thick durable hand - woven cloth .

19 [Ogede]59-ogede A spell for paralysing [an

enemy]177-an enemy .

20 Sanyan Brown woven cloth , much valued .

21 [Segi]60-segi A kind of coral bead , much valued .

22 [Agbada Yoruba gown]178-agbada yoruba gown .

23 Eba Food made from cassava

flour .

24 Egbe A spell giving [one]179-one the power to become invisible .

Forest ofa Thousand Daemons

THE AUTHOR MEETS AKARA - OGUN

[[My]0-i friends]180-my friends all , like the sonorous proverb do [we]181-our drum [the

agidigbo]182-the agidigbo ; it is [the wise who dance to it]183-the wise who dance to it , and [the learned who understand its language]184-the learned who understand its language . The story which follows is a veritable

agidigbo ; it is [I]0-i who will drum it , and [you]180-my friends [the wise heads who will interpret it]185-the wise heads who will interpret it . [[Our]181-our elders]186-our elders have a favourite proverb — are

[you]180-my friends not dying to ask [me]0-i how it goes?—they tell it thus ,

' When [our]181-our masquerade dances well , [our]181-our heads swell and do a[180-my friends]

spin . ' Forgive [my]180-my friends forwardness , it is the proverb which speaks .[180-my friends]

Now [I]0-i do not want [you]180-my friends to dance to [my]0-i drumming as a

mosquito to the deep bembe drums , its legs twitching haphaz-

ardly , at loggerheads with the drums . Dance [[my]0-i friends]180-my friends ,

in harmony , with joy and laughter , that [[your]180-my friends audience]188-your audience may ring [your]180-my friends brows with coins and pave [your]180-my friends path with clothing ;

that [men]189-men may prostrate before [you]180-my friends and [women]190-women curtsey in

sheer pleasure at [your]180-my friends dancing . But for a start , if [you]180-my friends want this dance to be a success , here are two things [I]0-i must request

of [you]180-my friends . Firstly , whenever [a character in [my]0-i story]191-a character in my story speaks in

[[his]191-a character in my story own person]192-his own person , [you]180-my friends must put [yourselves]180-my friends in [his]191-a character in my story place and speak as if [you]180-my friends are [that very man]193-that very man . And when the other replies ,

[you]180-my friends must relate the story to [yourselves]180-my friends as if [you]180-my friends , sitting down , had been addressed and now respond to [the first speaker]194-the first speaker .

In addition , as [men of discerning]195-men of discerning — and this is the second task [you]180-my friends must perform — [you]180-my friends will [yourselves]180-my friends extract various

wisdoms from the story as [you]180-my friends follow its progress .

Well , [I]0-i do not want to say too much at the start lest [I]0-i

become [a loquacious fool]196-a loquacious fool , [one who deserts the clearly blazed

path and beats about the bush]197-one who deserts the clearly blazed path and beats about the bush . [I]0-i will rather now take up [my]0-i 7

drum and set to it , and [I]0-i request [you]180-my friends to adjust [your]180-my friends agbada ,

toss its sleeve properly over [your]180-my friends shoulder , prepare [yourselves]180-my friends

for dancing , that the affair may dovetail neatly in the spirit of

the saying , ' [I]198-two grubs can dance and [you]180-my friends can drum ; this is the meeting[198-two grubs]

of [two grubs]198-two grubs . ' That , forgive [me]198-two grubs , is a proverb of [[our]2903-our elders]186-our elders .[198-two grubs]

It all began one beautiful morning ; a clear daybreak it

was , the harmattan haze had retreated [home]199-home , [the creatures of

[the forest]201-the forest]200-the creatures of the forest were still asleep , [those of [the backyard]203-the backyard]202-those of the backyard were feeding

on the day 's providence and birds were singing praises of

[[their]202-those of the backyard Maker]204-their maker . A beatific breeze rustled the dark leaves of [the

forest]201-the forest , deep dark and shimmering leaves , the sun rose from

[the East]19-the east in [God]72-god 's own splendour , spread its light into [the

world]206-the world and [the sons of]207-the sons of [men]189-men began [their]207-the sons of daily perambulations .

As for [me]0-i [I]0-i sat in [my]0-i favourite chair , settled into it with

voluptuous contentment , enjoying [my]0-i very existence .

Not long after [I]0-i was seated [an old man]209-an old man came up to [me]0-i and

greeted [me]0-i . [I]0-i returned [him]209-an old man courtesy for courtesy . Observing

what appeared to be a desire to stay [I]0-i offered [him]209-an old man a chair and

turned it to face [me]0-i . Once seated , [we]210-we began to exchange

pleasantries and share jokes like [old acquaintances]211-old acquaintances . But it

was not very long after when [I]0-i heard [the man]212-the man sigh deeply as

[one whose mind was troubled by a heavy thought]213-one whose mind was troubled by a heavy thought . Even as

[I]0-i began to consider asking [him]209-an old man the cause , [he]209-an old man began [himself]209-an old man

to speak thus :

' Take up [your]0-i pen and paper and write down the story[209-an old man]

which [I]0-i will now tell . Do not delay it till another day lest the

benefit of it pass [you]0-i over . [I]0-i would not [myself]0-i have come to

[you]0-i today , but [I]0-i am concerned about the future and there is

this fear that [I]0-i may die unexpectedly and [my]0-i story die with

[me]0-i . But if [I]0-i pass it on to [you]0-i now and [you]0-i take it all down diligently , even when the day comes that [I]0-i must meet [[my]0-i Maker]214-my maker , [the world]206-the world will not forget [me]0-i . '[214-my maker]

When [he]209-an old man had spoken thus [I]0-i hurried to fetch [my]0-i writing

things , brought them over to [my]0-i table , settled [myself]0-i in [com-

fort]216-com- fort , and let [the stranger]217-the stranger know that [I]0-i was now prepared for

8

[his]209-an old man tale . And [he]209-an old man began in the words that follow to tell [me]0-i the

story of [his]209-an old man life — [My]0-i name is [Akara - ogun]61-akara - ogun , [Compound - of - Spells]218-compound - of - spells , one of [the

formidable hunters of a bygone age]219-the formidable hunters of a bygone age . [[My]0-i own father]220-my own father was [a

hunter]221-a hunter , [he]220-my own father was also [a great one for medicines and spells]222-a great one for medicines and spells .

[He]220-my own father had a thousand powder gourdlets , eight hundred ato ,

and [his]220-my own father amulets numbered six hundred . [Two hundred and sixty incubi]223-two hundred and sixty incubi lived in [that house]224-that house and the birds of divination

were without number . It was [the spirits who guarded [the

house]226-the house when [he]220-my own father was away , and [no one]227-no one dared enter [that house]224-that house when [[my]0-i father]229-my father was absent — it was unthinkable . But deep

as [he]220-my own father was in the art of the supernatural , [he]220-my own father was no match for

[[my]0-i mother]230-my mother , for [she]230-my mother was [a deep seasoned witch from the cauld-

rons of hell]231-a deep seasoned witch from the cauld- rons of hell .

Once [[my]0-i father]229-my father had [nine children]233-nine children , of whom [I]0-i was [the eldest]234-the eldest ;

[four wives]235-four wives and [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother was [the most senior of [them]233-nine children]237-the most senior of them]225-the spirits who guarded the house when he was away , and no one dared enter that house when my father was absent — it was unthinkable . but deep as he was in the art of the supernatural , he was no match for my mother , for she was a deep seasoned witch from the cauld- rons of hell . once my father had nine children , of whom i was the eldest ; four wives and my mother was the most senior of them . [She]230-my mother had [four children]238-four children , [the wife who was next to [her]230-my mother]239-the wife who was next to her had three , [the

next two and the fourth had none at all]240-the next two and the fourth had none at all . One day [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother and [another of [these wives]243-these wives]242-another of these wives had a quarrel and took the case

to [[my]0-i father]229-my father for settlement . [He]229-my father found [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother at fault

and this so angered [her]230-my mother that [she]230-my mother resolved to take vengeance for the slight . [She]230-my mother became so ruthless in [her]230-my mother witching , that ,

before the year was out , [eight of [[my]0-i father 's children]247-my father 's children]246-eight of my father 's children were dead and [three of [[his]229-my father wives]249-his wives]248-three of his wives had gone the same way . Thus was [I]0-i left [the only child]250-the only child and [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother the only wife .

Look on [me]0-i , [[my]0-i friend]252-my friend , and if [you]252-my friend are not yet married

[I]0-i implore [you]252-my friend to consider the matter well before [you]252-my friend do .

True , [[your]252-my friend wife]253-your wife ought to be beautiful lest [you]252-my friend tire of [each other]254-each other quickly ; and a lack of brains is not to be recommended since [you]252-my friend must needs hold converse with [each other]254-each other , but this

is not the heart of the matter . The important requisite is that

[[your]252-my friend wife]253-your wife should not be prone to evil , for it is [[your]252-my friend wife]253-your wife who gives [you]252-my friend meat and gives [you]252-my friend drink and is admitted most to

[your]252-my friend secrets . [God]72-god has created [them]258-them such close creatures that

there hardly exists any manner in which [they]258-them can not come

9

' [My]259-a man name is [Akara - Ogun]61-akara - ogun , Compound - of - Spells . '[259-a man]

10

at [a man]259-a man ; and when [i]0-i tell [you]259-a man what [[my]0-i father]229-my father suffered at the

hands of [this wife of [his]229-my father]261-this wife of his , [you]259-a man will be truly terrified .

It happened one day that [[my]0-i father]229-my father prepared [himself]229-my father and

set off to hunt . After [he]229-my father had hunted a long while , [he]229-my father felt some-

what tired and sat on a tree stump to rest . [He]229-my father was not long

seated when , happening to look up , [he]229-my father saw the ground in

front of [him]229-my father begin to split and smoke pour upwards from the

rent . In a moment the smoke had filled [the entire area where

[[my]0-i father]229-my father sat so thickly that [he]229-my father could not see a thing ; all

about [him]229-my father had turned impenetrably black]263-the entire area where my father sat so thickly that he could not see a thing ; all about him had turned impenetrably black . Even as [he]229-my father began

to seek a way of escape [he]229-my father observed that the smoke had begun to fuse together in one spot and , before [he]229-my father could so much as

blink , it fused completely and a stocky being emerged sword

in hand and came towards [[my]0-i father]229-my father . [[My]0-i father]229-my father took to [his]229-my father

heels instantly but [the man]212-the man called on [him]229-my father to stop and began

to address [him]229-my father thus :

' Can [you]229-my father not see that [I]212-the man am not of [the human race]2905-the human race ? [I]212-the man arr-[212-the man]

ived even today from [the vault of [the heavens]269-the heavens]268-the vault of the heavens and it was on [your]229-my father account that [I]0-i am come hither , [my]0-i purpose being to

kill [you]229-my father . Run where [you]229-my father will this day ; kill [you]229-my father [I]0-i most reso-

lutely will . '[0-i]

When [he]229-my father had spoken thus , [[my]0-i father]229-my father was truly afraid but

even so [he]229-my father steeled [his]229-my father heart like [a man]259-a man and said , ' Truly , as[229-my father]

[I]0-i observe [you]229-my father , [I]0-i know [you]229-my father are not of [this world]272-this world , and [I]0-i see

also that the sword in [your]229-my father hand spells mortal danger for [me]0-i .

Nevertheless , [I]0-i implore [you]229-my father , and [I]0-i charge [you]229-my father in the name of

[the immortal God]273-the immortal god , do not fail to tell [me]0-i the nature of [my]0-i offence . '[212-the man]

[The man]212-the man replied to [him]229-my father , saying , ' Do [you]229-my father not know that[212-the man]

[you]229-my father have grievously offended [[your]229-my father Maker]275-your maker ? That [you]229-my father have ruined [his]275-your maker handiwork even to this extent , that [you]229-my father sent eleven

souls to [heaven]276-heaven when it was not yet the hour allotted [them]277-them by [[their]277-them God]278-their god ? '[229-my father]

These words of [his]212-the man were a great astonishment to [[my]0-i father]229-my father ,

for while it was true that [he]212-the man was well versed in magic and

11

charms , [he]212-the man did [no one]227-no one any evil . So [he]229-my father replied to [him]229-my father , ' If this[229-my father]

is indeed [your]229-my father complaint then [your]229-my father mission is to [a different

[He]229-my father waited for [[my]0-i father]229-my father to finish [his]229-my father speech and then [he]229-my father replied , ' True , [you]0-i have not with [your]0-i own hand killed [any-[229-my father]

one]2906-any- one , but [you]0-i have been responsible for the suffering of [poor innocents]289-poor innocents . With [your]0-i eyes wide open to what [you]0-i did [you]0-i married [a deep - dyed witch]290-a deep - dyed witch for the mere beauty of [her]290-a deep - dyed witch body — is

When [he]229-my father heard this , [the man]212-the man forgave [[my]0-i father]229-my father and desist-

moment [he]229-my father returned [home]199-home , put [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother to death . So saying ,

[he]229-my father turned into [the forest]201-the forest and continued [his]229-my father travels that way .

When [he]229-my father had gone [[my]0-i father]229-my father took up [his]229-my father gun and returned

[home]199-home . And it so happened that the path [he]229-my father took led [him]229-my father past

[a field of okro]307-a field of okro on the way to [the town]308-the town . It was evening when

12

[he]229-my father came [there]309-there , the moon was already up , and , coming up to

[the field]310-the field [he]229-my father looked over to the other side and observed some- one approaching from that direction . Quickly [he]229-my father climbed up a tree , waiting to see what [this person]311-this person was about . [The figure]312-the figure

came on unswerving until it vanished into a large anthill .

Shortly afterwards , an antelope emerged from this anthill ,

entered [the field]310-the field and began to feed on the okro . [[My]0-i father]229-my father

brought [his]229-my father gun to bear on the creature and drove furnaces

into its skull . The gun had no sooner roared than there came from the antelope a human cry and the words , ' Ah , woe is [me]229-my father ! '[229-my father]

That night [[my]0-i father]229-my father slept in [a little hut by [the field]310-the field]316-a little hut by the field . When daylight broke [he]229-my father went to the spot where the antelope was shot ,

but [he]229-my father found nothing there , only blood . [He]229-my father began to follow

the trail of blood , and it was with increasing astonishment that

[he]229-my father found that the trail led homewards . [He]229-my father followed [it]318-it until [he]229-my father

arrived right [home]199-home . But in [midtown the trail]320-midtown the trail vanished comple- tely and [he]229-my father did not come upon it again until [he]229-my father was nearly at [his]229-my father

own doorstep : then it led [him]229-my father straight into [[[my]0-i mother]230-my mother 's room]322-my mother 's room . [I]0-i had not [myself]0-i slept at [home]199-home that night . Whenever [[my]0-i

father]229-my father was away [I]0-i hated to spend the night at [home]199-home because

the spirits gave one no peace all through the night . Even [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother rarely slept at [home]199-home and then only when [[my]0-i father]229-my father

gave [his]229-my father permission . [I]0-i returned to [the house]226-the house just as [[my]0-i father]229-my father

was opening the door to [[[my]0-i mother]230-my mother 's room]322-my mother 's room , and when [he]229-my father had opened the door and [we]333-we entered , that moment when [I]0-i caught sight of [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother , it was all [I]0-i could do not to take flight .

From [her]230-my mother head down to [her]230-my mother shoulders was human enough , but the rest of [her]230-my mother was wholly antelope . [She]230-my mother was all covered in blood and swarms of flies . [[My]0-i father]229-my father touched [her]230-my mother ; [she]230-my mother was dead and had begun to rot . Indeed [she]230-my mother was the antelope steal-

ing out at night to feast in [the field of okro]336-the field of okro .

And so did [[my]0-i mother]230-my mother die , and hardly was a month over when [[my]0-i father]229-my father also followed [her]230-my mother . From that day was [I]0-i orphaned , [fatherless and motherless]339-fatherless and motherless . And thus ends the story [ofmy parents]340-ofmy parents

and comes the turn of [my]0-i own . [I]0-i greet [[your]341-your labour]342-your labour [[my]0-i friend]252-my friend .

FIRST SOJOURN OF [AKARA]20-akara - OGUN IN [THE FOREST]21-the forest OF

[A THOUSAND DAEMONS]344-a thousand daemons

The experiences which [[my]0-i father]229-my father underwent proved to be

nothing compared with [mine]0-i . And when [I]0-i go over it all in [my]0-i mind , [I]0-i am terrified to contemplate the case of [those who are

older]346-those who are older , because if [an old man]209-an old man began to recount all that had beset

[him]209-an old man on the path to the hoar on [his]209-an old man head , [many young men]348-many young men would pray for an early death .

By the time [I]0-i was ten [I]0-i had begun to accompany [[my]0-i father]229-my father

on [his]229-my father hunts and at fifteen [I]0-i possessed [my]0-i own gun . [I]0-i was twenty - five when [[my]0-i father]229-my father died , and , on [his]229-my father death , both the

money [he]229-my father owned and the powers [he]229-my father possessed , all formed [my]0-i legacy from [him]229-my father . Even before [he]229-my father died [I]0-i had killed [[my]0-i first ele-

phant]351-my first ele- phant , buffaloes had fallen at [my]0-i hand , there were few animals

in fact which [my]0-i gun had not yet swallowed .

About the third month of [my]0-i twenty - sixth year [I]0-i seized [my]0-i gun one afternoon and headed for [Irunmale]22-irunmale , [the Forest of [a Thousand Daemons]344-a thousand daemons]352-the forest of a thousand daemons . [A huge forest]354-a huge forest is [Irunmale]22-irunmale , a full six hours

from [[our]355-our town]356-our town . [The road to [it]354-a huge forest]357-the road to it is the same as that leading to

[Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo , and [that same road]358-that same road leads to [the dome of heaven]298-the dome of heaven . There is no breed of animal missing in [this forest]360-this forest [we]355-our speak of ; [it]360-this forest is the home of every vicious beast on [earth]361-earth , and [the

dwelling of every kind of feathered freak]362-the dwelling of every kind of feathered freak . Ah , [a most evil forest]363-a most evil forest

is [the forest of a thousand daemons]352-the forest of a thousand daemons ; [it]363-a most evil forest is the very abode of ghommids .

It was quite some time before [I]0-i arrived at [my]0-i destination ;

night was falling , [you]365-you could barely make out the lines on [your]365-you palm . [I]0-i was a little tired on arrival and could not even light

[my]0-i lamp for some night hunting . [I]0-i made a fire in the hollow of

14

a certain tree , took out a yam from [my]0-i hunting bag and began

to roast it . After this [I]0-i gathered up some fallen leaves and made a bed of them . [My]0-i pillow served for a hunting bag . [I]0-i primed

[my]0-i gun soundly and placed it next to [my]0-i head . That chore

completed , [I]0-i stretched out on [my]0-i back and went off to

sleep .

[I]0-i had not slept very long when 1 awakened , and indeed it was the cries of ghommids coming to trade at the night market

that woke [me]0-i . For while it is true that [they]366-they emerge both day

and night from [this forest]360-this forest , yet it is only at night that [they]366-they con-

duct [their]366-they business , and it is at night also that [they]366-they bring all

petitions forward to [[their]366-they king who is known as [Olori - igbo]62-olori - igbo ,

[Lord of [the Forests]25-forests]369-lord of the forests]368-their king who is known as olori - igbo , lord of the forests . With pity for [myself]0-i do [I]0-i tell [you]370-you now that that very tree underneath which [I]0-i had elected to build [my]0-i fire was the abode of [[their]366-they king]371-their king . Even up till the moment when [1 went off to sleep]372-1 went off to sleep [1]0-i had guessed nothing of this , and it was only when [I]0-i woke up and heard the sales cries of [the ghommids]373-the ghommids that [I]0-i was smitten with fear , and , quickly seizing [my]0-i gun and securing it across [my]0-i shoulders , [I]0-i hung [my]0-i bag around [my]0-i neck , caught hold of a creeper and climbed into the tree , little

dreaming that it was the head of [the king of ghommids [himself]371-their king

on which [I]0-i now chose to sport]374-the king of ghommids himself on which i now chose to sport . Thus it was that [I]0-i proceeded

to add insult to injury ; that [I]0-i had camped at [his]371-their king feet was not

enough , [I]0-i had to climb the head of [the unoffending man]375-the unoffending man . Some time went by after [I]0-i had climbed to the distant treetops ,

and then [the court nobility]376-the court nobility began to arrive . A huge fire leapt

up from some a^arter and the entire surround of the tree was lit up brightly . As the ghommids arrived [they]373-the ghommids sat round the

tree ; [they]373-the ghommids were all of a great variety , like the clothing of [ala-

genw]377-ala- genw — [some]378-some walked on [their]378-some heads , [others]379-others hopped frogwise ,

[one]179-one had neither arms nor legs ; [his]179-one appearance was like a rub-

bery tub . Last of all came [the king]381-the king 's crier and [he]371-their king began [his]371-their king sum- mons thus :

ghommids]2911-the merchant prince of 15 ghommids ; there is [no trader]382-no trader to equal [you]383-you . The arm of [the

And when [we]431-our think of [your]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning plight , [we]431-our pity [you]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning , [we]431-our weep for

tion , instead of [you]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning dancing to greet [us]431-our and fussing over [us]431-our ,

[you]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning find even [our]431-our mats a cause to despise [us]431-our , [our]431-our running

nostrils become [your]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning favourite target , [you]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning speak of [our]431-our solici-

to the extent that [you]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning have now coined the belittling expres-

sion , " Tears in the eye of [a gnom]432-a gnom . " Let [me]0-i not lie to [you]415-a huge swarthy man who kept up a stream of moaning , [I]0-i was somewhat ashamed listening to

the words of [this creature]433-this creature , for all [his]433-this creature insults on [mankind]434-mankind were well observed . However , inasmuch as [I]0-i did not want [him]433-this creature to

realise how [his]433-this creature words had hurt [me]0-i deep inside , [I]0-i burst out

[He]433-this creature had taken a few steps when [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , ' [A man]259-a man mends [his]259-a man fate with [his]259-a man own hands , why do [I]0-i not crave a boon from [this creature]433-this creature ? '[0-i] So [I]0-i called [him]433-this creature back , prostrated [myself]0-i

full length on the ground and begged [him]433-this creature to grant [me]0-i a boon . [He]433-this creature was very pleased that [I]0-i had acted in this manner and [he]433-this creature

gave [me]0-i four pods of alligator pepper ; [he]433-this creature gave them to [me]0-i in

two pairs and instructed [me]0-i that in time of danger [I]0-i should eat

a single pepper from one of the first pair of pods , whereupon [I]0-i would grow wings and fly like a bird . And the moment [I]0-i

wished to retract the wings , one pepper from the other two

19

pods would produce the desired result . When [I]0-i tried out this

formula , it proved a sure - fire treatment .

After [he]433-this creature had passed on this gift , [he]433-this creature went [his]433-this creature way and [I]0-i tur-

ned into [the forest]201-the forest , seeking game . [I]0-i walked some distance and the animals leapt about while [I]0-i sought [my]0-i chance to take care-

ful aim . And yet again [I]0-i came upon another abbreviated [crea-

ture]64-crea- ture driving away the game . [He]433-this creature was shorter still than the one [I]0-i

had met before and [his]433-this creature entire body was uncompromisingly black . Once again [I]0-i grew infuriated and spoke fiery words to

[him]433-this creature : ' [You]433-this creature are [wicked creatures]2918-wicked creatures , [you]433-this creature ghommids , pitiless as[0-i]

well , and that is probably why [your]433-this creature growth is stunted since [you]433-this creature are occupied with nothing but pointless acts . Game there is

[others]379-others alone to hunt . '[433-this creature]

with one long look , hissed in contempt and began to speak :

' [I]433-this creature am [the Crown Prince of Forests]2919-the crown prince of forests , [the bog - troll who lives[433-this creature]

in crevices of the mahogany]2920-the bog - troll who lives in crevices of the mahogany . Have [you]433-this creature never heard of [me]0-i ?

son]438-my per- son ? That [a mere son of man]439-a mere son of man dare not affront [my]0-i presence ?

Forest of [a Thousand Daemons]344-a thousand daemons]352-the forest of a thousand daemons . Diminutive though [I]0-i appear , [I]0-i

pursue the task which [[my]0-i Creator]443-my creator has assigned to [me]0-i : [I]0-i walk the walk of the wise , [I]0-i act with the nature of the discerning .

[I]0-i never reach for that which [my]0-i hand can not encompass , nor

do [I]0-i embark upon that which is beyond [my]0-i power ; [I]0-i do not act

in the manner of the thoughtless , nor do [I]0-i complete an action

beyond [your]444-you powers , [you]444-you forget that the tongue of [men]189-men is mere-

And thus [he]0-i had [his]0-i say and went [his]0-i way . [I]0-i was now tho-

roughly fed up with the whole business ; [every ghommid alike]456-every ghommid alike

appeared to use [me]0-i ill . After [this one]457-this one had gone , [I]0-i began to sense

[I]0-i found it was a brown and white - patch monkey . A shot

bagged [me]0-i the monkey , [I]0-i tucked it in [my]0-i bag , tossed it onto

[my]0-i head , and , gun on shoulder , directed [my]0-i legs to [[my]0-i rude

hunting - lodge]458-my rude hunting - lodge at the base of the palm tree .

On arriving there , [I]0-i took up [my]0-i knife and skinned it ,

built a little truss no higher than [my]0-i knee , stacked a fire beneath ,

piled [my]0-i venison on top of it and fired it . That which [I]0-i did

not pile on the truss , the scraps and tit - bits , [I]0-i began to roast

in the fire , eating them on the spot . Highly enjoyable they

were too for the meat of the monkey oozes delicious juices .

Not long afterwards , it darkened , and towards the eighth

hour of the evening [I]0-i lit [my]0-i hunting - lamp and began to seek

game . [I]0-i did not search very far before [my]0-i eyes fastened on another pair of eyes belonging to some creature , gleaming

a short way from [me]0-i . [I]0-i shot and killed it and it turned out to

be a civet . [I]0-i took it to [[my]0-i camp]459-my camp , skinned and carved it , piled

the pieces beside the monkey and cracked the fire up at them .

[I]0-i did not trouble to hunt any more that night , and when [I]0-i had tended the civet , [I]0-i lowered [my]0-i back to [the earth]460-the earth and dropped off to sleep , and it was not till the cooing of the cuckoo that

[I]0-i awoke the following morning .

21

—

On the dawning of the next day therefore — and this was the third day of [my]0-i sojourn in [the Forest of Irunmale]28-the forest of irunmale — [I]0-i ate ,

filled up properly so that [my]0-i belly protruberated most roundly .

[I]0-i reached for [my]0-i gun , primed it diligently , seized [my]0-i hunting-

bag , slung it over [my]0-i shoulder and so into [the forest]201-the forest . It

grieves [me]0-i to admit that [I]0-i had out - eaten remembrance of

those charms which [I]0-i should have taken with [me]0-i . [I]0-i left them at the foot of the palm and took nothing but the shot for [my]0-i gun , and [my]0-i cutlass .

[I]0-i had not walked very far before [I]0-i began to encounter

game , but [they]462-they would not be patient and persisted in running

pointlessly about . And just when an opportunity presented

ing ; indeed , it was no less [a monster]464-a monster than [the sixteen - eyed

dewild]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild ; often had [I]0-i listened to [hunters]466-hunters recount tales of [him]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild [Agbako]65-agbako , that is [his]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild name . When [I]0-i set eyes on [him]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild , [I]0-i was — unless [I]0-i lie in this matter

smitten with terror . [He]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild wore a cap of iron , a coat of brass ,

and on [his]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild loins were leather shorts . [His]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild knees right down to

[his]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild feet appeared to be palm leaves ; from [his]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild navel to the

bulge of [his]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild buttocks , metal network ; and there was no creature on [earth]361-earth which had not found a home in this netting

which even embraced a live snake among its links , darting

[His]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild head was long and large , the sixteen eyes being arranged

around the base of [his]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild head , and there was [no living man who could stare into those eyes without trembling , they rolled

endlessly round like the face of a clock]469-no living man who could stare into those eyes without trembling , they rolled endlessly round like the face of a clock . [His]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild head was matted

[him]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild and cast [him]465-the sixteen - eyed dewild in the bush . But even as [the road]472-the road obeyed [me]0-i ,

But just as [he]59-ogede was flung into the bush even so [I]0-i was served ,

and [I]0-i found [myself]0-i face to face with [him]59-ogede and the ropes began to bind [me]0-i . When the thongs began to strangle , [I]0-i yelled on [the

forest]201-the forest to release [me]0-i and set [me]0-i back on [the road]472-the road . [It]483-it obeyed .

Needless to say , [Agbako]65-agbako was there to welcome [me]0-i . So , seeing

how things stood , [I]0-i prepared for fight and [we]484-we joined in a

death grapple . [We]484-we fought for long but neither toppled [the

other]485-the other . [We]484-we were smothered wholly in sweat , [my]0-i eyes were reddened and , as for [Agbako]65-agbako , [his]65-agbako eye - balls were as blood-

drops . The ground on which [we]484-we fought shone like glazing .

Later , [I]0-i tired , but not [he]65-agbako . [I]0-i untwined [my]0-i arms but [he]65-agbako held

fast to [me]0-i . But when [he]65-agbako perceived [himself]65-agbako that [I]0-i was too ex-

into a keg of palm - wine . [Agbako]65-agbako sat [him]65-agbako down and began to serve [me]0-i , and [he]65-agbako refreshed [himself]65-agbako also . When the keg of

And shortly after , every being in [the Forest of Irunmale]28-the forest of irunmale came , the ghommids on one side , the birds on one side , the

[The ghommids]373-the ghommids had been watching [us]487-we for a while when [I]0-i saw one of [them]373-the ghommids detach [himself]65-agbako from the rest and come to the

which [I]0-i took and ate . And instantly a new vitality flooded [me]0-i and [my]0-i strength became the strength of [sixteen men]491-sixteen men . [I]0-i bul-

led into [Agbako]65-agbako and seized [him]65-agbako by the neck , when [I]0-i had squeezed it hard [he]65-agbako bellowed like a beast and [all the ghommids]492-all the ghommids cheered .

But when [I]0-i tried to lift [him]65-agbako from the ground and smash [him]65-agbako in the fatal throw , [his]65-agbako foot did not even turn aside ;

firm [he]65-agbako was as a lode in a crag . And [he]65-agbako in turn strove to lift

25

[my]0-i leg to [his]65-agbako shoulder , slap off the other foot and paste [my]0-i marrow on the ground , but [he]65-agbako failed in this and [I]0-i stood robust-

And then it was that [he]65-agbako slarruped sparks ablaze in [my]0-i face ,

proving to [me]0-i that [he]65-agbako was indeed [Agbako]65-agbako [the Master]493-the master . [He]65-agbako thudded earth with [his]65-agbako feet and the earth opened beneath

When [I]0-i arrived at [the interior of [earth]361-earth]495-the interior of earth , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i in

[a strange house]497-a strange house . Of [Agbako]65-agbako there was no sign , and until [my]0-i return from this trip [I]0-i did not set eyes on [Agbako]65-agbako again .

Not until the day of [our]494-us journey to [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo was [I]0-i to encounter [him]65-agbako again — [you]498-you will hear about this later — but

what [I]0-i experienced until [my]0-i escape from the depths of [earth]361-earth

[I]0-i will never forget in this lifetime , and when [I]0-i am gone to

[heaven]276-heaven [I]0-i will remember it all , even there , for ever and ever .

[The house in which [I]0-i found [myself]0-i]501-the house in which i found myself was of modest size ,

cowdung was used in plastering the floor and the walls also ,

but the ceiling was lined entirely with guns . There was neither

window nor door , yet [the house]226-the house was full of light ; where this

light came from remained a puzzle . [I]0-i first discovered [myself]0-i right in the centre of [the room]503-the room , and even as [I]0-i stood inspecting

[[my]0-i prison]504-my prison , [I]0-i saw the four walls of [the house]226-the house coming towards [me]0-i , so that [the room]503-the room became progressively smaller as if the

walls planned to squeeze [me]0-i to death . [I]0-i was most afraid ,

but when it lacked only a little for [them]507-they to come to grips

with [my]0-i body , [they]507-they returned to [their]507-they position and [the house]226-the house was as before . And just as [they]507-they regained this position and [my]0-i heart began to settle back , the armoury of the ceiling began to fire , [the house]226-the house began to shake and [I]0-i felt [I]0-i was about to

fall ; disorientation became [my]0-i lot like the monologue of a

gnom . [I]0-i stumbled here and there , fell , and settled on all

fours . [I]0-i was in this position when [my]0-i eyes went blind and [I]0-i

felt hands begin to touch [me]0-i : it was a very cold touch . After

26

a while [these people]510-these people began to dance round [me]0-i , clapping [their]510-these people

hands above [my]0-i head ; [I]0-i heard [their]510-these people footsteps distinctly , as

the footsteps of [a hundred people]511-a hundred people . [They]510-these people did not stay doing

this for very long before [they]510-these people seized [me]0-i and began to toss

[me]0-i up , catch and toss [me]0-i up again . Not long afterwards [they]510-these people

set [my]0-i feet to the ground and began to undress [me]0-i and place

different clothing on [me]0-i , laughing all the while . Then [one]179-one

rubbed [his]179-one hand over [my]0-i face and [I]0-i regained [my]0-i sight , but

when [I]0-i looked round [I]0-i saw [no one]227-no one ; [I]0-i found [myself]0-i on a large

chair , [my]0-i size was enormous and [I]0-i was covered in feathers .

[I]0-i had grown in size , but [my]0-i entire body was not uniformly

increased ; [my]0-i arms had not changed , [my]0-i legs had neither

lengthened nor thickened , but [my]0-i belly was twelve times

distended and [my]0-i head sixteen times its normal size . [My]0-i neck

was not much thicker but was stretched beyond imagination .

[I]0-i was highly amused when [I]0-i beheld [myself]0-i , and there was no choice but to sit quietly . [I]0-i did not rise for fear that [my]0-i legs

would not support [my]0-i stomach , for even as [I]0-i sat [my]0-i head became a heavy burden on [my]0-i neck ; there was simply no strength to the neck .

Some time went by and [I]0-i began to feel hungry . Even as

[I]0-i began to consider how [I]0-i might find some way to a little

food , [I]0-i saw in front of [me]0-i two balls of eko and meat stew .

[I]0-i tried to edge closer to start [my]0-i meal but [I]0-i soon discovered

that [my]0-i stomach permitted no approach to the food ; it had taken up [the entire room]514-the entire room . As [I]0-i began to manoeuvre towards this food , [I]0-i was astonished to see it come towards [me]0-i , and soon enough it settled where [my]0-i hand could reach it . [I]0-i took a morsel and accompanied it mouthwards but , alas , [I]0-i found only then that [my]0-i hand no longer came up to [my]0-i mouth . [My]0-i neck was excessively elongated , it more resembled a heron 's ,

and its bone was hard as rock so that it could not be bent .

[Anyone who wants a laugh]515-anyone who wants a laugh should have come and seen [me]0-i struggling to lead some food into [my]0-i mouth . Whenever it

lacked only little for the morsel to touch [my]0-i lips the arm

27

would reach its limit , and when [I]0-i tried forcibly to propel the

morsel to its destination oil flowed down [my]0-i hands and [my]0-i neck was full of food crumbs .

Listen , [[my]0-i good friend]516-my good friend , the soul which does not eat hot

peppers is a weak soul ; [I]0-i love food , [I]0-i simply can not endure

hunger . Because of this [I]0-i was known to [many people]517-many people as

' [Akara - ogun]61-akara - ogun , the one who accompanies [the cook to the[0-i]

grave]2922-the cook to the grave ' . This nickname of [mine]0-i will give [you]2923-you some idea how [my]0-i innermost being craved this food . Even as [I]0-i continued[0-i]

the struggle [I]0-i saw a small flat stick nearby , reached gingerly

for it , dug it into the eko and began to convey some food to [my]0-i mouth . The quantity lifted by the stick was far larger than

[my]0-i mouth could admit for [my]0-i mouth had not increased its

former size , and when this huge lump of eko landed just inside

[my]0-i lips it blocked [my]0-i mouth entirely , and as [I]0-i strove to eat

down the inside portion so as to attack the outside , that por-

tion fell away from [my]0-i mouth . Even so did [I]0-i vainly struggle ,

and [I]0-i could not enjoy [my]0-i meal .

From the moment [I]0-i began this effort to eat [I]0-i had heard

voices laughing quite close to [me]0-i , but [I]0-i did not see [anyone]282-anyone .

When [I]0-i had done [my]0-i best and eaten next to nothing , [I]0-i cried

to [them]519-you : ' [You]519-you who laugh over there , [I]0-i implore [you]519-you in the name of[0-i]

[God]72-god , if it was [you]519-you who changed [me]0-i into what [I]0-i am [this mo- ment]520-this mo- ment , do not fail to return [me]0-i to what [I]0-i was before . It was

ignorance which led [me]0-i to fight with [Agbako]65-agbako ; never again

will [I]0-i attempt such folly . If [I]0-i hear news of [Agbako]65-agbako 's approach

in future [I]0-i will learn to start a rapid dialogue with [my]0-i legs

and ram [my]0-i head through forests . [I]0-i appeal to [you]519-you , kindly

release [me]0-i . '[0-i]

When [I]0-i had spoken thus , [they]519-you remained silent . After a

while , [my]0-i stomach began to retract , [my]0-i head diminished ,

[my]0-i neck shortened and soon every part returned to normal .

From the moment [I]0-i returned to [my]0-i normal shape [I]0-i no lon-

ger heard a sound from these ghommids , but [the house]226-the house did

28

not cease to behave in its original manner , and , anyway ,

[I]0-i did not discover a means of escape . Some time passed to-

wards nightfall , and then [I]0-i saw a wall of [the house]226-the house split in

two and [a beautiful woman]523-a beautiful woman came in with [a number of young maidens]524-a number of young maidens , several of [them]524-a number of young maidens and all more beautiful than coral .

[I]0-i was smitten with fear at the sight of [them]524-a number of young maidens and [I]0-i threw

[myself]0-i face downwards on the floor . But [the woman]525-the woman came to

[me]0-i and said :

' [Akara - ogun]61-akara - ogun , [you]0-i are aware that even as dewilds exist[525-the woman]

on [this earth]526-this earth , so do spirits exist also ; even as [spirits]527-spirits exist so

also do [kobolds]528-kobolds ; as kobolds on [this earth]526-this earth , so are gnoms ; as gnoms so also exist the dead . [These ghommids]530-these ghommids and [trolls]531-trolls

together make up [the entire thousand and one daemons who exist upon]532-the entire thousand and one daemons who exist upon [earth]361-earth . [I]0-i am one of [them]524-a number of young maidens , and [Helpmeet]66-helpmeet is [my]0-i name .

[I]0-i love [the Lord]534-the lord and [he]534-the lord loves [me]0-i also ; [he]534-the lord has never denied

[me]0-i aught , nor have [I]0-i ever failed to perform an errand on which [he]534-the lord has sent [me]0-i . Thrice in one day [I]0-i go through [the

world]206-the world to visit [the friends of God]536-the friends of god and to assist [them]536-the friends of god in all

[their]536-the friends of god endeavours ; whoever bears only a little love to [Him]534-the lord , [I]0-i perform a little service for [him]534-the lord ; and [he]537-he who loves [[my]0-i God]538-my god with a great love [I]0-i care for in as great a proportion ; whoever acts with concern towards [Him]534-the lord [I]0-i treat with concern , and whoever treats [Him]534-the lord with disrespect even so do [I]0-i act towards

[him]534-the lord ; for whoever sows well shall harvest goodness , and whoever sows evil , evil shall come unto [him]534-the lord . [The truthful]539-the truthful

shall not fail to profit good , [the deceitful]540-the deceitful shall gain nothing

but deceit ; even if it came to pass that [the world]206-the world turned

topsy - turvy , that fowls grew teeth and the oil palm grew coconuts , [God]72-god will not fail to reward [every man]542-every man according

to [his]542-every man deeds . So now , [you]543-you [Akara - ogun]61-akara - ogun , rise and follow [me]0-i ,

for [you]543-you are a most important instrument for [[your]543-you Creator]544-your creator . '[545-she]

When [she]545-she had finished , [I]0-i rose and followed [her]545-she , and [we]546-we emerged from [this house]547-this house into a certain bush and so continued

[our]546-we progress . [We]546-we traversed [valleys]548-valleys and traversed hills ; [we]546-we crept under creepers and waded through swamps . After a

29

while [we]546-we arrived at [a crossroads]549-a crossroads where [she]545-she stopped and showed [me]0-i a route , saying :

' Go on now and pay attention to the things [you]0-i shall wit-[545-she]

ness in [this city]550-this city ; never fear and be not cowed by terror , [my]0-i name is [Helpmeet]66-helpmeet , [I]0-i will never desert [you]0-i on [this earth]526-this earth . '[66-helpmeet]

After which , [I]0-i set [my]0-i head along [that road]552-that road , and [she]545-she also

went [her]545-she way . [I]0-i walked a little while and arrived at [a certain

city]553-a certain city . From [my]0-i entry through the city gates until [I]0-i arrived at

[the market square]554-the market square — this was roughly ten minutes — [I]0-i heard not

a single voice even though [I]0-i encountered [many people]517-many people , and when [I]0-i called out greetings to [them]517-many people [they]517-many people would merely mumble in [their]517-many people noses nor did [I]0-i understand one word [they]517-many people mumbled . When [I]0-i arrived at [[their]517-many people market]556-their market [I]0-i stood by a certain tree and began to watch .

What amazed [me]0-i most of all in [this market]557-this market was that [many children]558-many children were dead in [it]557-this market yet [no one]227-no one made any attempt to bury

[them]558-many children . Corpses littered [the place]560-the place in prodigious numbers , [the

entire market]561-the entire market stank and flies swarmed over [it]561-the entire market with an incessant

buzz . [I]0-i waited a little and then [I]0-i saw [a woman]562-a woman approach and greet [me]0-i . This made [me]0-i happy and [I]0-i responded eagerly ; [I]0-i then

went on to tell [her]562-a woman how astonishing a matter [I]0-i found it that

[no one]227-no one spoke at all among [these market crowds]564-these market crowds , that [they]564-these market crowds

should all merely mumble , and although [1]565-1 had greeted [many of

[them]564-these market crowds whom [I]0-i encountered not one of [them]564-these market crowds]566-many of them whom i encountered not one of them deigned to respond

to [my]0-i greeting .

ed , saying :

' [My]562-a woman name is [Iwapele]67-iwapele and the name of [this city]550-this city is Filth . [It]550-this city is [a[562-a woman]

place of suffering and contempt]2925-a place of suffering and contempt , [a city of greed and contumely]567-a city of greed and contumely ,

[a city of envy and of thievery]568-a city of envy and of thievery , [a city of fights and wrangles]569-a city of fights and wrangles , [a

city of death and diseases]570-a city of death and diseases — [a veritable city of]571-a veritable city of [sinners]572-sinners . Once upon a time , [the people of [this city]550-this city]573-the people of this city committed a most atrocious

crime ; a very evil deed it was — so evil that the sun did not

shine for six entire months , nor did the moon emerge for three

whole years ; the rain fell no more and the corn did not come

30

to fruit , the yam did not sprout and plantains refused to ripen ;

everything was in utter confusion . After a while , however ,

[God]72-god took pity on [the inhabitants of [the town]308-the town]575-the inhabitants of the town ; [he]72-god remembered that [these people]510-these people were after all [his]72-god own creation ; [he]72-god forgave

[them]510-these people but warned [them]510-these people never to repeat [their]510-these people offences , and every-

thing returned to its previous good . But when [they]510-these people had again

eaten well and drunk to satisfaction , [they]510-these people forgot who made [them]510-these people ; [they]510-these people began to walk in the path of [their]510-these people own choosing

and to act in any manner that pleased [them]510-these people . But [[their]510-these people Maker]204-their maker saw [them]510-these people from heaven , for all acts of [mankind]434-mankind are observed

by [God]72-god and there is nothing hidden from [Him]72-god . Therefore

[He]72-god sent [[his]72-god emissaries]580-his emissaries to enquire into the misdeeds of [this city

of blood]581-this city of blood ; [they]580-his emissaries came in the guise of [men]189-men and [they]580-his emissaries lodged at [[my]0-i house]583-my house . [I]0-i took good care of [them]580-his emissaries and honoured [them]580-his emissaries ; [I]0-i wel-

comed [them]580-his emissaries hands and feet , took such care of [them]580-his emissaries as was within [my]0-i power . [They]580-his emissaries did not stay long with [me]0-i , only long

[They]580-his emissaries turned [the dwellers of [this town]586-this town]585-the dwellers of this town into [a race of the dumb]587-a race of the dumb and punished [them]585-the dwellers of this town all with blindness ; [the city]588-the city became [a city

of curses]589-a city of curses for ever , but [I]0-i was spared by [God]72-god . Now that [I]0-i have

set eyes on [you]590-you [I]0-i do not want [you]590-you ever to depart from [me]0-i .

[I]0-i want [you]590-you to dwell with [me]0-i that [I]0-i may hold converse with [you]590-you and [you]590-you with [me]0-i , for it is the company of the open that the

open keeps , it is the company of the masquerade that [the mas- querader]591-the mas- querader seeks , the fish swims after the company of fishes in

[the river]592-the river ; [you]590-you are of [my]0-i own kind . '[593-her]

When [she]593-her had finished [I]0-i replied that [I]0-i would do exactly as

[she]593-her counselled for [I]0-i was tired of so much aimless wandering .

But [I]0-i sought [her]593-her indulgence to stay a little and observe the

events in [this market]557-this market before [we]595-we went on to [[her]593-her home]596-her home . It was only after [her]593-her speech that [I]0-i realised that [these people]510-these people were all

blind and dumb , and the factor which had made [me]0-i unsus-

pecting was that [their]510-these people eyes were wide open as if [they]510-these people could see ;

little did [I]0-i know that the eyes which [they]510-these people carried about with

[them]510-these people were eyes of deceit .

31

Many , many things did [my]0-i eyes behold but [I]0-i will not state

them all now , [I]0-i will recount them another day . Nevertheless

[I]0-i will tell [you]598-you a little of [them]510-these people lest it appear that [I]0-i skip over this

episode entirely .

The first incident [I]0-i saw concerned [a certain man]599-a certain man , a cripple ,

who walked with the aid of a crutch . [This man]600-this man went very fast

and hopped about on [his]600-this man staff , and [he]600-this man soon bounded past [me]0-i in the direction of [a pond]601-a pond . Seeing how close [he]600-this man was to [it]601-a pond , [I]0-i

cried a warning to [him]600-this man that [his]600-this man course was no thoroughfare but

[he]600-this man paid no heed . On arriving at the edge [he]600-this man leapt straight into

[the pond]602-the pond . [He]600-this man was thoroughly soaked and [I]0-i found [myself]0-i full

of pity for [him]600-this man . But instead of distress , [this man]600-this man simply burst

into laughter ; [he]600-this man emerged from [the pond]602-the pond and continued [his]600-this man

mad dash all over [the place]560-the place . [He]600-this man had not hopped more than

three times when [he]600-this man leapt against [a woman]562-a woman . [This woman]607-this woman was

enraged but as [she]607-this woman lifted [her]607-this woman arm to strike [the offending man]608-the offending man ,

it was [a totally different person whom the arm encountered]609-a totally different person whom the arm encountered

and [he]600-this man in turn grew wrathful . [He]600-this man raised [his]600-this man hand in vengeance

but administered the punishment to yet [another man]610-another man . Before

long the fight spread to [the entire market crowd]611-the entire market crowd and [they]611-the entire market crowd began

to strike [one another]612-one another . As [they]611-the entire market crowd rushed here and there [several

babies]613-several babies fell off [[their]613-several babies mothers]614-their mothers ' backs and it was over [their]613-several babies heads[615-the combatants]

that [the combatants]615-the combatants charged to meet [one another]612-one another . In the same manner [the aged among [them]611-the entire market crowd who had little strength to prop

down on [the battleground]620-the battleground and [the mother]621-the mother stooped to pick it up ,

instead of [hers]621-the mother [she]621-the mother picked up another 's ; some picked up [dead

32

Many sights did [I]0-i witness in [this market]557-this market but they are far be-

liceman]637-the po- liceman would seize one of [the nobility]638-the nobility , and before [he]637-the po- liceman dis-

covered [the victim]639-the victim 's true identity , would have served [him]259-a man many slaps in rapid succession ; at times when [the king]381-the king tried to mount [his]381-the king horse [he]381-the king landed on a cow ; even so did the affairs of [these

people]510-these people run higgledy - piggledy , topsy - turvy .

From the day of [my]0-i arrival in [this town]586-this town there had been [a

room in [the house where [I]0-i lived]644-the house where i lived which [the woman]525-the woman , [[my]0-i host]646-my host ,

val , asked [me]0-i never to go into [that room]647-that room as long as [she]525-the woman was alive , but that after [her]525-the woman death [I]0-i could do whatever [I]0-i pleased

for [the entire house]648-the entire house would then be [mine]0-i . [The woman]525-the woman and [I]0-i

[I]0-i had not thought that [this woman]607-this woman would die before [me]0-i , for

[I]0-i was by far [the elder]653-the elder ; only when [she]525-the woman had thus died did [I]0-i ac-

knowledge that [children and aged alike]654-children and aged alike , none can escape the

hand of death . After [her]525-the woman death [I]0-i wept till [I]0-i nearly went blind ,

forgetting that weeping does not bring the dead back to life ,

but only puts [the living]655-the living in peril . Let [the wailer]656-the wailer weep eternally

and the sighing sigh for ever , [he]656-the wailer who must can not help [his]656-the wailer

going .

After [the woman]525-the woman 's death , [I]0-i began to seek some way of escap-

ing from [this town]586-this town and , as [I]0-i sat down one day thinking how [I]0-i

should proceed , [my]0-i mind went to [the room which [the woman]525-the woman had forbidden [me]0-i to enter]659-the room which the woman had forbidden me to enter . [I]0-i rose from the ground , put on [my]0-i clothes and headed for [this room]661-this room as [I]0-i wanted to see what it

contained . On the point of opening the door , [I]0-i was at first

33

afraid , but when [I]0-i recalled how much [I]0-i had undergone in the

past [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i that [I]0-i simply had to open it ; whatever would come of it , let it come : and so [I]0-i threw it open . The very

[home]199-home , and when [I]0-i looked round [I]0-i found [my]0-i gun which [I]0-i had lost at [the place where [I]0-i did battle with [Agbako]65-agbako]665-the place where i did battle with agbako ; [I]0-i found [my]0-i hunting - bag and a few other articles which [I]0-i had lost in [the

Forest of]21-the forest [a Thousand Daemons]344-a thousand daemons and when [I]0-i looked into the

Thus ends the story of [my]0-i first sojourn in [this most terrifying

forest]668-this most terrifying forest . [I]0-i would now like [you]669-you to find [me]0-i a little food for

hunger is at hand . When [I]0-i have done with eating [I]0-i will lay [my]0-i tongue to the tale of [my]0-i second journey , and that story is even

more delectable than the one that has gone before .

Even so did [this man]600-this man narrate the adventures of [his]600-this man first jour-

ney to [the Forest of]671-the forest of [a Thousand Daemons]68-a thousand daemons . When [his]600-this man tale was ended [I]0-i brought [him]600-this man food and [he]600-this man ate , but [I]0-i saw that night was approaching , so [I]0-i suggested that [he]600-this man retire for the day and re-

turn at break of the following day . [I]0-i accompanied [him]600-this man some of

34

SECOND SOJOURN OF [AKARA - OGUN]61-akara - ogun IN [THE FOREST OF]21-the forest [A THOUSAND DAEMONS]344-a thousand daemons

When [the man]212-the man had departed and [I]0-i had returned [home]199-home [I]0-i called

[[my]0-i neighbours]676-my neighbours together ; [I]0-i summoned [friends]677-friends and [acquaint-

ances]678-acquaint- ances , sent for [[my]0-i relations]679-my relations also and recounted this affair to

[them]679-my relations . [They]679-my relations were greatly amazed and all resolved to wake early the following morning before [[my]0-i stranger]680-my stranger arrived , so

that [they]679-my relations might [themselves]679-my relations listen to [the man]212-the man 's adventures , for

[my]0-i re - telling could not aspire to [their]679-my relations own participation . True enough , sharp on the moment the new day began to break ,

[they]679-my relations began to arrive , and by the time that [the man]212-the man [himself]212-the man enter-

ed [[my]0-i house]583-my house it was filled to overflowing and could hardly take

another pair of feet . Before dawn [I]0-i had ordered [[my]0-i servants]684-my servants

to prepare food , and so before [the stranger]217-the stranger began [his]217-the stranger tale [I]0-i

placed before [[my]0-i guests]686-my guests four baskets of eko and ladled meat into dishes for [them]686-my guests . Each and [every man of [us]688-us]687-every man of us ate to satisfac-

tion and drank , after which [the stranger]217-the stranger rose and began to

speak as follows :

[I]0-i am happy to see [you]690-you all , [friends]677-friends , sitting here — young and old , male and female . Were it not for the great affection [you]690-you bear [[my]0-i friend]252-my friend , [I]0-i would not find [you]690-you [here]693-here . When [I]0-i came yes-

terday [I]0-i did not meet [any one of [you]690-you]694-any one of you , there was only [this friend

of mine]695-this friend of mine . [He]695-this friend of mine bade [me]0-i welcome , took good care of [me]0-i , and be-

haved towards [me]0-i with the nature of courtesy itself . [My]0-i pray-

er therefore is , may [God]72-god let this kind of conduct remain among [us]696-us black races for ever .

Without a doubt , [[my]0-i friend]252-my friend has told [you]690-you the tale about [[my]0-i parents]698-my parents , and about the various things which [I]0-i experienced when [I]0-i visited [the Forest of Irunmale]28-the forest of irunmale . And [I]0-i think [I]0-i do not lie

35

when [I]0-i say that [anyone who has listened to these adventures]699-anyone who has listened to these adventures could not fail to believe that [I]0-i would never dream of hunting again . But no , [I]0-i did hunt again , for it is in the profession to

which [a man]259-a man is trained that [he]259-a man must serve ; the goods which [he]259-a man truly understands are what [a trader]701-a trader sells , and it was not fitting

that [I]0-i should leave [my]0-i profession at the prime of day and turn

to masonry or wood - carving . But certain it is also that , if [you]690-you learnt that [I]0-i had indeed returned to hunting , [you]690-you could hardly imagine that [I]0-i would return to [the Forest of [a Thousand Dae- mons]703-a thousand dae- mons]702-the forest of a thousand dae- mons . [I]0-i wish to let [you]690-you know that it was to [this very place that

[I]0-i turned [myself]0-i]704-this very place that i turned myself . [[He]705-he who must do what [no one]227-no one has done before

[him]706-he who must do what no one has done before him]706-he who must do what no one has done before him will experience that which [no man]708-no man has experienced before .

[No hunter]709-no hunter makes a habit of exploring [the Forest of Irunmale]28-the forest of irunmale as [I]0-i did , [no hunter]709-no hunter undergoes such punishment as came to [me]0-i . [I]0-i endured plenty ; and even so should it be with [me]0-i , for there

is truth in this saying of [[our]711-our elders]186-our elders — [The aggressive man]713-the aggressive man dies

the death of war , [the swimmer]714-the swimmer dies the death of water , the

vainglorious dies the death of [women]190-women ; it is the trade of the

cutlass that breaks its teeth , the food [we]711-our eat is what fills [our]711-our bellies — may God forbid that what [you]716-you eat bring about [your]716-you death .

A clear year after [my]0-i return from the first adventure , [I]0-i once again took hold of [my]0-i gun one night and set [my]0-i head on [the

road to [the Forest of Irunmale]28-the forest of irunmale]717-the road to the forest of irunmale , all eager to do some hunting .

When [I]0-i left [home]199-home [I]0-i had imagined that it was on the verge of

dawn , but the truth was that [I]0-i had set out in the very dead of

night ; the brilliant dawn - lingering phase of the moon had de-

ceived [me]0-i into thinking that a new day was about to break .

However , by the time [a man]259-a man could begin to distinguish the

lines on [his]259-a man palm , it lacked only two hours for [me]0-i to arrive at

[my]0-i destination . It was a different route which [I]0-i took to [the For-

est]720-the for- est this time . [I]0-i did not wish to return the former way lest it ap-

pear that [I]0-i sought out trouble with [my]0-i own hands and met

the consequent misadventures , that [I]0-i pulled the whirlwind

down on [my]0-i own head .

36

[I]0-i arrived finally just about breakfast time ; quickly [I]0-i made a

fire and roasted a piece of soft yam . [My]0-i meal over [I]0-i tucked [my]0-i pipe into [my]0-i mouth and lit it ; [my]0-i body was filled with pleasure

and tingled all over with well - being . After a while [I]0-i put out [my]0-i pipe and replaced it in [my]0-i pocket . When [I]0-i looked up [I]0-i found

two kolanut trees , one had no fruits but the other had some .

[I]0-i plucked the fruits of the latter and found three pods . When [I]0-i had split them all open the nuts numbered ten . [I]0-i took the larg-

est of them and peeled it , its skin was wafer dry ; [I]0-i broke it

open and it pared in four . So , since this variety of kolanut is

excellent for ritual offering to the gun , [I]0-i propped up [my]0-i gun and offered the kola . But when [I]0-i cast the pieces , the result was inauspicious . For if it spoke good , would two pieces not face

down and the other two up ? Alas it was not so for [me]0-i , some- times three pieces faced down and one up , and at other times

all four faced down — the matter of this kolanut was simply

beyond [my]0-i comprehension . So when [I]0-i had cast them many times without good augury , with [my]0-i own hands [I]0-i turned two up and faced two down saying , ' With [his]259-a man own two hands does[0-i]

[a man]259-a man mend [his]259-a man fortune ; if [you]722-you kola pieces will not predict

good , [I]0-i will predict that good for [you]722-you . ' After [I]0-i was done [I]0-i picked[0-i]

up [my]0-i gun and proceeded to [the forest of game]723-the forest of game . Even as [I]0-i stood up , [I]0-i stubbed [my]0-i left foot ; this was [my]0-i ma-

ternal foot and whenever [I]0-i stumbled by this foot over any mat-

ter , that affair would not prosper . This frightened [me]0-i some- what , and while [I]0-i stood pondering on this unlucky foot an owl flew past and its wings hit [me]0-i in the face ; [a most evil omen]724-a most evil omen was this . [I]0-i stood for nearly ten minutes thinking about these omi-

nous signs but in the end [I]0-i simply bartered death away saying ,

' What of it ! Does [a man]259-a man die more than once ? If death must take [me]0-i then let [me]0-i get on [my]0-i way . '[0-i] [I]0-i plunged into [this forest]360-this forest

and began to seek game . After a long while [I]0-i saw an antelope ,

with its haunches turned to [me]0-i . [I]0-i waited some time for the

creature to turn its head towards [me]0-i but it did not oblige ;

thereupon [I]0-i loosed a shot at it . The animal was hit but the

37

shot was not lethal . [It]726-it leapt into a zig - zag flight and [I]0-i in turn seized [my]0-i cutlass and gun and chased it . [I]0-i chased it over a long distance but did not catch up with it ; after a while [it]726-it fled into a

cave within a large rock and [I]0-i followed [it]726-it inside .

[The cave]727-the cave was large and exceedingly dark ; from the moment [I]0-i entered [it]727-the cave [I]0-i no longer saw the antelope , [I]0-i could only follow the thud of its hooves . But after a while there came the moment when [I]0-i neither saw the antelope nor heard [its]726-it hooves . [It]726-it puzz- led [me]0-i how it could have vanished in the middle of [this place]728-this place

and [I]0-i began to hunt [it]726-it everywhere . [I]0-i was occupied with this

when [I]0-i suddenly felt [someone]729-someone seize [me]0-i by the right hand , twist

the arm behind [my]0-i back and fetch [me]0-i a slap on the ear . [This person]311-this person 's hand had a severe sting to it ; even as [I]0-i struggled to

free [myself]0-i from [his]311-this person grip [he]311-this person used [his]311-this person left hand to grip [me]0-i by the neck and , when [he]311-this person had squeezed it tight , began to push [me]0-i forward with regular shoves , slapping [me]0-i as [we]731-we went along .

When , after some time , the punishment became unbearable [I]0-i

began to cry out , ' Please let [me]0-i go , [I]0-i will never again touch [your]311-this person antelope . Please , [I]0-i will never again kill [your]311-this person game .[0-i]

. . ' But [he]311-this person made no reply ; [he]311-this person continued to shove [me]0-i along and pun- ish [me]0-i as [he]311-this person went . Sometimes [he]311-this person would pinch [me]0-i , other times[0-i]

[he]311-this person would rap [me]0-i on the head ; there was no variety of torment [he]311-this person did not devise for [me]0-i and [I]0-i could not even see [him]311-this person because

it was pitch dark . It seemed a long time before [we]731-we emerged in the open , and only then did [I]0-i observe [the man]212-the man ; [he]212-the man was not

much above short and [his]212-the man back had an enormous hunch , fins

covered [his]212-the man body so that it had the appearance of a fish . [He]212-the man had two arms , two legs , and two eyes like [a human being]733-a human being , but [he]212-the man had a small tail at [his]212-the man posterior and [his]212-the man eyes were enormous ; each

one was six times the normal size and red as palm kernels .

When [we]731-we came out into the open [he]311-this person ordered [me]0-i to stoop and place [my]0-i hands on [my]0-i knees and [I]0-i obeyed [him]311-this person . When [he]311-this person ob-

served that [I]0-i had done so [he]311-this person mounted [my]0-i back , kicked [me]0-i and

ordered [me]0-i to bear [him]311-this person about as if [I]0-i was a horse . Like it or

not [I]0-i had to do this also . [I]0-i want [you]734-you to know that [he]311-this person had

38

seized [my]0-i gun before [we]731-we came out of [the cave]727-the cave , and when [he]311-this person

was astride [my]0-i back it was [he]311-this person who held on to it .

[We]731-we emerged into tall grass and it was here that [my]0-i torment

was most severe . Before [he]311-this person climbed on [my]0-i back [he]311-this person had cut

several switches and kept them by [him]311-this person , and from the moment [he]311-this person spurred [me]0-i and turned [my]0-i head in the direction of [his]311-this person

choice [he]311-this person began to laugh and to drip saliva on [my]0-i head ;

whenever [I]0-i tried and sought to raise [my]0-i head a little [he]311-this person would lay about [me]0-i with the whips and [I]0-i would at once resume the

race . Sometimes [he]311-this person would ask [me]0-i to neigh like a horse and when [my]0-i voice did not simulate a horse 's satisfactorily [he]311-this person

would blast [my]0-i ears with several slaps . Sometimes [he]311-this person demand- ed that [I]0-i toss [him]311-this person up and down like a horse , and there was no remedy but to obey [him]311-this person ; if [I]0-i did not [he]311-this person would thrash the

very breath out of [me]0-i . It was during these riding sessions that

[we]736-we arrived at a spot where there was a large hole . [He]311-this person dis-

mounted and took a thick rope , tied [my]0-i hands together behind

[me]0-i , then entered deeper into this hole and returned with a

large chain which [he]311-this person hooked round [my]0-i neck . [He]311-this person did not make it too tight but slackened it a little so that [I]0-i was able to breathe

comfortably . [He]311-this person then tied the chain to a tree and returned

into [the cave]727-the cave ; this was [the home of [the creature]739-the creature]738-the home of the creature .

It would be about two o'clock when [we]736-we came to [[this man]600-this man 's dwelling]741-this man 's dwelling , and when [I]0-i saw that [he]311-this person was safely in , [I]0-i took hold

of tears and began to weep them . [I]0-i was careful to cry very

softly lest , overhearing [me]0-i , [he]311-this person return to punish [me]0-i even

more . About half past four , [the man]212-the man came out from [the cave]727-the cave

and approached [me]0-i ; [he]212-the man pressed on [my]0-i stomach to see if [I]0-i

was hungry and when [he]212-the man observed that [my]0-i stomach was little better than flat [he]212-the man returned into [the cave]727-the cave and brought

before [me]0-i . [He]212-the man put it down and told [me]0-i to kneel and eat it

directly with [my]0-i mouth . [I]0-i tried a little of this yam but [my]0-i throat was not too favourable towards it , so [I]0-i left the rest
