As [you]748-you will surely realise , [I]0-i did not sleep till daybreak .

[I]0-i was full of doleful thoughts and frequently sobbed aloud .

The following morning [[my]0-i captor]749-my captor fed [me]0-i on raw yams as

on the previous day and again [I]0-i galloped [him]212-the man around till

nightfall of that day ; at evening [we]745-we returned to [[his]212-the man cave]750-his cave

and once more [he]212-the man chained [me]0-i by the neck to a tree , and when [he]212-the man had fed [me]0-i on raw yams , re - entered [[his]212-the man home]746-his home and slept .

[You]748-you will be thinking by now that [I]0-i ought somehow to have freed [myself]0-i during this length of time — and rightly too .

What made the situation so dismal was that [he]212-the man had seized

[my]0-i gun from the moment of [my]0-i capture and when [he]212-the man arrived

[home]199-home [he]212-the man took it into [the cave]727-the cave ; [he]212-the man even took [my]0-i hunting - bag

at the same time . And from the day that [I]0-i came to [that place]754-that place ,

[he]212-the man never allowed [me]0-i to enter [[his]212-the man home]746-his home : whenever [we]756-we returned

to [the cave]727-the cave , it was the chain for [me]0-i . [I]0-i tried the few spells and charms which [I]0-i had left on [my]0-i person but none of them had any effect . [I]0-i invoked , bullied and commanded [ogede]59-ogede but

the matter seemed to have no solution .

Much later , however , [I]0-i began to understand where [I]0-i had erred . [I]0-i realised that [I]0-i indulged in magical arts but had failed

to reckon with [God]72-god . [I]0-i forgot that [He]212-the man created the leaf and created the bark of the tree . Before daylight broke on [my]0-i third day [I]0-i cried to [God]72-god and prayed :

' [Ruler of skies]2927-ruler of skies , Owner of this day , this matter is much beyond [me]0-i . Help [me]0-i now , help [me]0-i for [I]0-i can not do it by [myself]0-i[0-i]

alone . [O God]72-god , do assist [me]0-i in this . Forbid it that [I]0-i become meat for [this creature]433-this creature ; forbid it that [he]433-this creature use [my]0-i skull for a

bugle . Let [me]0-i not perish in [this forest]360-this forest ; forbid it that from [this

spot]760-this spot [I]0-i become a voyager to [heaven]276-heaven : let [me]0-i not die the death

of a fowl ; forbid it that [this man]600-this man devour [me]0-i as a cat devours mice . Let [the masquerader]763-the masquerader worship the mask for as long as [he]763-the masquerader pleases , [he]763-the masquerader must return to render account to [you]764-you ; let [the

[The Moslems]767-the moslems worship [you]764-you as [Anabi]71-anabi , [the Christians]768-the christians offer [you]764-you every minute

of [their]767-the moslems existence . [I]0-i implore [you]764-you rescue [me]0-i , [I]0-i can not alone

Even so did [I]0-i pray that night and [I]0-i rested [my]0-i hopes in [God]72-god . The following morning when [the man]212-the man emerged as usual and offered [me]0-i the usual raw yams , [I]0-i was inspired by [God]72-god to ask

[him]212-the man a small question .

' Pardon [me]212-the man , [Master]2928-master , [I]212-the man beg of [you]2928-master , do not fail to tell [me]212-the man why it is that [you]2928-master do not cook [your]2928-master yam before [you]2928-master eat it . '[212-the man]

[He]212-the man looked at [me]0-i with wide - mouthed astonishment and

confessed that [he]212-the man was not aware that there was such a thing

as went by the name of cooked yam . So [I]0-i elaborated further

on it , saying that when yam is cooked it is far more delicious

than when it is eaten raw . So [he]212-the man asked [me]0-i if perchance [I]0-i

could cook this yam for [him]212-the man and , when [I]0-i answered yes , [he]212-the man

unchained [me]0-i . [I]0-i made a fire and cooked the yam , and when it was done [I]0-i peeled and offered it to [him]212-the man . When [he]212-the man tasted

this yam it tickled [his]212-the man palate no end and [he]212-the man began to talk

to [me]0-i with interest .

As [we]770-we were speaking thus [we]770-we touched on the subject of

the gun and [he]212-the man demanded to know what was the use of it .

[I]0-i replied at once that it was a gadget for enjoyment , and that

if [I]0-i thrust the muzzle of this gun in the mouth of [anyone]282-anyone and

gently caressed its stock at the base , water would flow from

the gun of such a quality that [the man]212-the man would experience no

thirst for seven clear days . When [he]212-the man heard this [he]212-the man hurried

into [the cave]727-the cave and brought out [my]0-i weapon , eagerly [he]212-the man thrust

the muzzle in [his]212-the man mouth and bade [me]0-i caress it at the base .

The bird is already eager to fly and idle hands pelt it with

42

—

stones — this was exactly how the matter was . [I]0-i took the gun in [my]0-i hand , blazed away and heard it roar . Down fell [the

man]212-the man , dead .

Even so did [I]0-i bring about the end of [this man]600-this man , but [I]0-i must rejoice no further , for [I]0-i had not the least idea where [I]0-i was .

But first , after [I]0-i had despatched [him]212-the man , [I]0-i entered [the cave]727-the cave , and when [I]0-i was deep inside [I]0-i discovered all manner of precious

things segi , coral beads , waist beads and expensive cloths

such as velvet , sanyan , red northern , dyed cloth and exqui-

sitely seasoned kijipa which had been smoothly beaten . And [I]0-i discovered various kinds of headgear , okiribi , dog - ears and plain hats . [I]0-i found also three crowns which were made of

beads ; if [a king]777-a king put these on , [his]777-a king face would be invisible , for

these beads hung down right round the crown ; they were beautiful beyond words . [I]0-i found a stack of yams also , and took some which [I]0-i cooked . After this [I]0-i selected the most valuable of these treasures , packed them properly , took [my]0-i gun and [my]0-i hunting - bag and began to feel [my]0-i way around until [I]0-i could arrive at [a familiar spot]778-a familiar spot and head for [home]199-home . rather than soften , the fronds of the coconut palm merely

stood stiffer . The more [I]0-i sought a way out , the deeper [I]0-i was lost .

drums . Before long [I]0-i came upon [a settlement]781-a settlement ; [it]781-a settlement was [a city

of ghommids]782-a city of ghommids . These were different from the usual run of

of [the town]308-the town]785-the crown prince of the town was holding a celebration and [the entire populace]618-the entire populace

had instructed [someone who stood close to [him]371-their king to summon [me]0-i to [him]371-their king]794-someone who stood close to him to summon me to him . [I]0-i went , and when [I]0-i was close to [him]371-their king and saw that

of men]448-the sons of men . [They]796-them frighten [them]796-them by day and chase [them]796-them about at night , [they]796-them indulge in the habit of taunting [them]796-them and [they]796-them

[I]0-i was truly happy to hear this from [the king]381-the king and as [1]0-i sat

It was a long while before the dancing stopped , and [the

king]381-the king took [me]0-i to [[his]381-the king palace]813-his palace and placed delicious dishes before

home]820-my 44 home to look up [[my]0-i own people]821-my own people , [he]381-the king would provide those

[I]0-i stayed very long in [this town]586-this town and [I]0-i enjoyed [myself]0-i beyond measure . [The king]381-the king loved [me]0-i more than life ; everyday [he]381-the king sought new ways of diverting [me]0-i , [he]381-the king indulged [me]0-i and con-

to render satisfaction to [them]828-the townspeople all even in so far as it lay within

[my]0-i power . There was nothing which [any one of [them]828-the townspeople]830-any one of them would request of [me]0-i which met with a denial ; there was nowhere [the

king]381-the king would send [me]0-i that [I]0-i would not go : it was much as if

in [that town]840-that town . And it so happened one day that [[my]0-i friend]252-my friend came to [me]0-i and said , ' [Akara - ogun]61-akara - ogun , would [you]0-i ever guess that [the[252-my friend]

people of [this town]586-this town]2931-the people of this town plan to kill [the king]381-the king ? It is painful to have

[I]0-i was greatly frightened to hear this and [I]0-i went to [the king]381-the king

and told [him]381-the king everything . [He]381-the king very nearly refused outright to

45

The following morning after [the king]381-the king and [[his]381-the king wives]249-his wives had eaten , [[his]381-the king woman]855-his woman hailed [the king]381-the king and said , ' [Kabiyesi]73-kabiyesi , there[855-his woman]

is a little matter [I]0-i forgot to mention yesterday . 1 visited with

[another of [[your]381-the king wives]858-your wives [a friend of [yours]381-the king]859-a friend of yours]857-another of your wives a friend of yours and [he]859-a friend of yours made [us]860-us a

present of four kolanuts . [We]860-us shared them between [us]860-us , and [my]0-i portion came to two . As [you]381-the king know very well [I]0-i can not eat

anything and ignore [you]381-the king , so [I]0-i kept [yours]381-the king wrapped in a leaf

when [I]0-i ate mine . [I]0-i even meant to give it to [you]381-the king yesterday but

accept it for what it is worth . ' When [she]867-the wife had finished [she]867-the wife[381-the king]

end of [the ocean]393-the ocean , [no one]227-no one can see the end of [the seas]1050-the seas , [no one]227-no one will

ed]1052-those who will surely be destroy- ed by [their]1052-those who will surely be destroy- ed own envy can not see the end of [you]1042-noble king — never !

[I]0-i thank [you]1042-noble king greatly for bringing this matter before [the people]977-the people .

dog]1059-the man who first informed the king about the missing 53 : dog . It is [this man [we]1058-we must insist]1061-this man we must insist should find the dog because

a chain descended from heaven and tied [them]1088-the youths up , leaving [them]1088-the youths high up in the air . And there [they]1088-the youths stayed until [they]1088-the youths began to rot ,

[I]0-i woke very late the following day , the sun was already up .

[AKARA - OGUN]61-akara - ogun AND [LAMORIN]76-lamorin

[I]0-i walked through [this tunnel]1201-this tunnel for about an hour before [I]0-i

emerged into the light , and [I]0-i picked up the stone and kept

it in [my]0-i hunting bag — since the beginning of [my]0-i recent hard-

ships [I]0-i had stuck close to [my]0-i gun and [my]0-i hunting - bag . No sooner was [I]0-i out than [I]0-i encountered [a man whose name was [Lamorin]76-lamorin]1202-a man whose name was lamorin ; [this man]600-this man had been lost in [the deep jungle]1204-the deep jungle for the

past three years .

When [he]600-this man set eyes on [me]0-i [he]600-this man rejoiced right down to [his]600-this man

deepest marrow for [we]1205-we were neighbours in [[my]0-i hometown]1206-my hometown . [We]1205-we exchanged affectionate greetings and [we]1205-we exchanged tales

of [our]1205-we adventures — [my]0-i own experiences were nothing com-

60

pared to those of [Lamorin]76-lamorin , for it was a long time indeed

since [he]600-this man had been lost , or last set [his]600-this man eyes on [[his]600-this man home]746-his home .

[We]1205-we journeyed together and arrived at [a certain river]1208-a certain river .

As [we]1205-we went along [the bank of [the river]592-the river]1209-the bank of the river [we]1205-we saw [a giant of a

man]1211-a giant of a man before [us]1205-we ; [he]1211-a giant of a man carried a huge bag over [his]1211-a giant of a man arm and was

stark naked . In [his]1211-a giant of a man hand [he]1211-a giant of a man held the head of a lion which

[he]1211-a giant of a man chewed as [he]1211-a giant of a man walked and , as [he]1211-a giant of a man caught sight of [us]1205-we , [he]1211-a giant of a man

dropped the head and made directly for [us]1205-we . Instantly [I]0-i heard

[Lamorin]76-lamorin cry out loud and warn [me]0-i to take to [my]0-i heels ;

was a ghommid , and when [he]1218-a tall figure had taken two morsels from the

67

4

THE EXPEDITION TO [MOUNT LANGBODO]23-mount langbodo

News had gone round [the city]588-the city that [a certain elderly man]1340-a certain elderly man came daily to tell [me]0-i tales of marvel , and before the early cock crowed the following day , [the entire populace]618-the entire populace had arrived ;

[they]618-the entire populace covered [[my]0-i home]819-my home like a swarm of locusts . So when [I]0-i saw [the house]226-the house would take no more , [I]0-i began to spread mats outside

[the house]226-the house . [I]0-i unrolled mats until the mats were used up , then

had to go round and beg for mats where [I]0-i could . [I]0-i borrowed a

hundred and fifty before [I]0-i could pause , and even these did not

suffice ; some climbed trees , [many]1345-many sat on [the rooftop]1346-the rooftop — they

were as a flock of weaver - birds frolicking on the crown of the

palm .

Not long afterwards [the man]212-the man arrived and , even as [he]212-the man app-

eared to [us]1348-you , [he]212-the man cried , ' [I]212-the man cast aside all that went before and bring[212-the man]

fell silent in anticipation and [he]212-the man continued to speak :

' Ah , the sands on [the sea shore]2946-the sea shore can not be counted , the[212-the man]

works of [God]72-god are truly innumerable . When [I]0-i first set eyes

upon [you]1348-you [I]0-i was full of fear , but when [I]0-i drew near [my]0-i fear

deserted [me]0-i . For at first [I]0-i could not help but think that when all of [you]1348-you will have died , all the iroko in [the neighbouring bush]1349-the neighbouring bush

will not yield enough planks to bury [you]1348-you ; but in the end [I]0-i took

heart for [I]0-i remembered that it is not [everyone of [you]1348-you who will

' [I]1351-his listeners will surely die a peaceful death ! [I]1351-his listeners will surely die a peaceful[1351-his listeners]

68

death . . ' . . While [they]1351-his listeners were repeating this , [he]212-the man waved to [them]1351-his listeners[1351-his listeners]

thorns , [the honest man]1352-the honest man is the foe of [the world]206-the world . [I]0-i wish to ask

[you]1348-you four questions ; if [you]1348-you can answer them it means then that

[I]0-i am at fault in what [I]0-i said , but if [you]1348-you can not it means that [you]1348-you have not understood [me]0-i at all . These are the questions : [I]0-i would like one of [you]1348-you to rise and tell [me]0-i precisely on what day [he]1354-he

shall die ; then [I]0-i want [him]1354-he to tell [me]0-i what manner of death [he]1354-he

[this person]311-this person will die — will it be at [home]199-home or on [the farm]1357-the farm , will it

be on [the roadside]1358-the roadside or in [[his]1354-he bedroom]1359-his bedroom ? In [a strange land]1360-a strange land or in

[this very town]1361-this very town ? And lastly , this — let [this man]600-this man tell [me]0-i step by

of [his]1354-he death . Let [him]1354-he not omit to tell [me]0-i when [he]1354-he will stub [his]1354-he

[the majority of [lizards]1365-lizards]1364-the majority of lizards do indeed press [their]1364-the majority of lizards bellies to the

[I]0-i performed yet another deed of an arduous nature .

It happened this way — it was in fact the season of harmat- tan and [I]0-i rose late in the morning , for since [I]0-i became wealthy

covered in palm leaves — [I]0-i little dreamt that [he]89-kako was getting mar- ried to a ghommid on that very day . :

a matter of shame for [us]1479-we , and it would also appear that [we]1479-we only care about [our]1479-we individual selves and recognise nothing

where [we]1479-we triumph in [these forests]1492-these forests , [we]1479-we must return [home]199-home some day . [My]0-i words are , [I]0-i hope , worthy of [your]1494-your consideration [[my]0-i friend]252-my friend . '[0-i]

Let [us]1479-we , unlike the mat unfolding on the ground , cut a long

story short — [Kako]89-kako gathered together [his]89-kako possessions , got

ready and followed [me]0-i .

According to the custom of ghommids in [the Great Forest]1496-the great forest ,

[man]2901-man and [woman]1498-woman must live together for seven years before

[they]1499-they undergo the ceremonies of a wedding . By then [the

woman]525-the woman would have given [him]89-kako [children]1122-children , and [both man]1502-both man and [wife]295-wife would be thoroughly accustomed to [each other]254-each other 's ways .

If at the end of this period [they]1499-they find [each other]254-each other compatible ,

[they]1499-they get married — this , in [their]1499-they idiom , is a white wedding .

If however matters stand otherwise , [they]1499-they take leave of [each

other]254-each other with mutual satisfaction , [the man]212-the man to seek [a new wife]1508-a new wife ,

[the woman]525-the woman to hold [herself]525-the woman in readiness for [another man]610-another man . It

was this custom which accounted for the fact that [I]0-i found [Kako]89-kako all decked out in palm leaves on [his]89-kako wedding day .

[You]1511-you will have guessed from this that [Kako]89-kako had lived with [[his]89-kako

woman]855-his woman for seven years before [our]1513-our reunion in [the Great Forest]38-the great forest , and it is an amazing thought that throughout [his]89-kako

preparations , and even up to the moment when [he]89-kako followed

[me]0-i on this wedding day , [he]89-kako had not informed [[his]89-kako bride]1514-his bride . It

was most unbecoming behaviour .

But when [the woman]525-the woman learnt of [his]89-kako departure , [she]525-the woman flew after

[us]1513-our , and , catching up , clung to [his]89-kako feet and spoke thus

' What can the matter be , [[my]525-the woman husband]1286-my husband ? What trouble have [I]525-the woman stirred awake ? What offence have [I]525-the woman committed to warrant[525-the woman]

this ? In what manner have [you]1516-you been aggrieved ? Did [you]1516-you discover [me]0-i with [another man]610-another man ? Have [I]0-i ever spoken in an

75

—

unseemly manner to [you]1516-you ? Have [I]0-i neglected to show [my]0-i love sufficiently ? Were [you]1516-you told [I]0-i brawl in public ? Did [you]1516-you hear gutter language from [my]0-i lips ? Am [I]0-i extravagant ? Am [I]0-i vain ? Or is it that [I]0-i am unclean in [my]0-i habits ? Are [[my]0-i man-]1518-my man- ners careless or disrespectful towards [you]1516-you ? Am [I]0-i obstinate

towards [you]1516-you ? Or is it that [I]0-i am a failure as [housekeeper]1519-housekeeper ? Have [I]0-i failed to look after [[your]1516-you guests]1520-your guests in a fitting manner ? Could it be that [I]0-i am simply a failure when it comes to seeing

to [your]1516-you comfort ? Do n't [I]0-i know how [a woman]562-a woman talks to [[her]562-a woman

husband]889-her husband ? Or is it that [I]0-i have failed to help [you]1516-you in [your]1516-you own work ? What conceivable crime could it be ? Tell [me]0-i , please

tell [me]0-i , in [God]72-god 's name do n't fail to tell [me]0-i , [[my]0-i lord]861-my lord , [[my]0-i hus-

band]1524-my hus- band , [[my]0-i beloved]1310-my beloved . '[1524-my hus- band]

[Kako]89-kako replied and said to [her]1526-you , ' In truth , [a woman who knows all these cautions [you]1526-you have set down]2961-a woman who knows all these cautions you have set down could never offend[89-kako]

[[her]562-a woman husband]889-her husband , and , unless [I]0-i lie in the matter , [I]0-i must admit that

[you]1526-you have never offended in one of them , not even in the matter

of late meals of which [thousands of women]1528-thousands of women are guilty every

hour upon earth . But when a crisis comes , it comes , and that

is that . At twilight , hundreds of leaves slumber on the bough ; come darkness and beasts roam [the forests]1288-the forests in [their]1530-their hundreds

there is a time for everything ; a time to play , a time to fight ;

a time for tears , a time even for joy ; this is [my]0-i time for

departure , and [my]0-i going will yield to nothing . Therefore , go on [your]1526-you way , and [I]0-i on [mine]0-i . If [you]1526-you find [another husband]1531-another husband ,

[we]1532-we d [him]1531-another husband ; but do not count on [Kako]89-kako any more — [the son of

[strangers]1534-strangers]1533-the son of strangers departs on the business of [[his]1533-the son of strangers homeland]1318-his homeland — fare [you]1526-you well . '[1526-you]

On hearing these words of [Kako]89-kako , [the woman]525-the woman burst into

tears and entreated [him]89-kako again , but [he]89-kako made no pretence of

listening ; [he]89-kako simply grabbed [his]89-kako club , stuck [his]89-kako matchet in its sheath and walked on briskly as when [the office clerk]1537-the office clerk

hurries to [[his]89-kako place of business]1538-his place of business . When [the woman]525-the woman saw that the

matter was past helping , [she]525-the woman began to speak most piteously

in the following words :

76

' Ah ! Is this now [my]525-the woman reward from [you]89-kako ? When at first [you]89-kako courted [me]525-the woman [I]525-the woman refused [you]89-kako , but [you]89-kako turned on the honey[525-the woman]

tongue and fooled [me]0-i until [I]0-i believed that there lived [no man like [you]89-kako]1540-no man like you . [I]0-i gave [you]89-kako [my]0-i love so selfiessly that the fever of love

seized [me]0-i , that the lunacy of love mounted [my]0-i head , that

love 's epilepsy racked [me]0-i on [your]89-kako account . [I]0-i could not eat

unless [I]0-i saw [you]89-kako , [I]0-i could not drink unless [you]89-kako were with [me]0-i ;

if [I]0-i wished to go out [you]89-kako had to come with [me]0-i , if [I]0-i heard

[your]89-kako voice anywhere [I]0-i had to seek [you]89-kako [there]309-there , and whenever

[my]0-i passion overwhelmed [me]0-i [I]0-i would leave [[my]0-i home]819-my home and

wander near [yours]89-kako , talking fast and loud so that [you]89-kako might

know [I]0-i was nearby . [You]89-kako know that [I]0-i have neither [father]1543-father nor

[mother]1170-mother , that [I]0-i have [no siblings younger or older]1545-no siblings younger or older ; alone [you]89-kako have replaced all these for [me]0-i . Now when hands have clasped

hands and feet slid in step [you]89-kako threaten to abandon [me]0-i at

the very height of day ! [You]89-kako wish that [I]0-i should become the

laughing - stock of [all the forest beings who will jeer and say

to [me]0-i , " [You]89-kako were so damned sure]1546-all the forest beings who will jeer and say to me , " you were so damned sure ; well , tell [us]1547-us , can it be

done ? " Ah , may [God]72-god judge [you]0-i guilty [you]0-i despoiler of lives ! '[1170-mother]

And [she]1170-mother wrapped [herself]1170-mother tightly round [Kako]89-kako saying , ' [You]89-kako are going nowhere , not until [you]89-kako find some way to dispose[1170-mother]

of [me]0-i . '[1170-mother]

[Our]1548-our delay grew longer with [the woman]525-the woman 's desperate hold

and [Kako]89-kako grew truly angry . [His]89-kako face was transformed and [he]89-kako pulled out [his]89-kako matchet , saying , ' [Woman of death]2962-woman of death , [mother of witchery]2963-mother of witchery seeking to obstruct [my]89-kako path of duty , know [you]525-the woman not that before [earth]361-earth destroys [the evil - doer]2965-the evil - doer , much good has[89-kako]

already suffered ruin ! Before [God]72-god adjudges [me]0-i guilty [I]0-i shall

pass sentence on [your]525-the woman guilt . ' And , having spoken , be slashed[525-the woman]

[her]525-the woman amidriffs , and it lacked only a little for [the woman]525-the woman to be

cloven clean in two ; [she]525-the woman fell on earth twitching in the final

throes of death crying the name of [Kako]89-kako , crying [his]89-kako name into [the other world]1551-the other world . Great indeed was [my]0-i terror !

[We]1552-we set upon [the road]472-the road and headed for [home]199-home . [We]1552-we both slept

at [[[my]0-i father]229-my father 's house]1556-my father 's house on that night , for [Kako]89-kako has [no dwelling

in [the town]308-the town]1557-no dwelling 77 in the town . The following morning [I]0-i went to [the king]381-the king and

told [him]381-the king that it would be good to set a date for [our]1552-we departure

and [we]1552-we settled for nine days hence .

For those nine days [Kako]89-kako and [I]0-i made merry , for [many of [[our]1552-we

friends who had lived in [the jungle]1562-the jungle]1561-our friends who had lived in the jungle for a long time returned

Like a light wind the seven days blew away and on the night

by dawn the following morning [we]1552-we had cooked yam , pounded

and breakfasted on it . By half past eight in the morning [we]1552-we were ready and [we]1552-we proceeded to [the palace]893-the palace where [the king]381-the king

was assembled , [the crowd was numerous as an invasion of

locusts]1571-the crowd was numerous as an invasion of locusts on [a farm]1572-a farm . [Several of [the hunters]1574-the hunters]1573-several of the hunters had not arrived when [we]1552-we got [there]309-there but by ten o'clock [they]1573-several of the hunters were all assembled . Ah [[my]0-i friends]180-my friends , narrating is [the poor brother of witnessing]1577-the poor brother of witnessing ; [these

hunters]1578-these hunters filled the hearts of [the beholders]1579-the beholders with awe . [They]1578-these hunters

[I]0-i can not give [you]1582-you all [their]1578-these hunters names but will tell [you]1582-you a little

about [the most important six in the expedition]1583-the most important six in the expedition , [those who were the most intrepid and the most experienced]1584-those who were the most intrepid and the most experienced . These , when

names as [they]1578-these hunters lined up in front of [the king]381-the king . [The first]1587-the first was

[Kako]89-kako of the Leopard Club , but [his]89-kako history [you]1582-you already know .

Next stood [Imodoye]92-imodoye who is [a maternal relation of [mine]0-i]1588-a maternal relation of mine .

When [he]92-imodoye was only ten [he]92-imodoye was snatched away by the Whirl-

wind and [he]92-imodoye lived for seven years with [him]92-imodoye . In all those seven

years [he]92-imodoye lived on a single alligator pepper every day . [He]92-imodoye was

78

well versed in charms , wise and very knowledgeable , [he]92-imodoye was

also [a highly titled hunter]1589-a highly titled hunter . These qualities earned [him]92-imodoye the

name of [Imodoye]92-imodoye , that is , knowledge fuses with understand-

ing . [I]0-i stood in the third position . [Fourth]93-fourth was [Olohun - iyo]94-olohun - iyo ,

[the Voice of Flavours]1590-the voice of flavours ; [he]92-imodoye was [the most handsome of all men on [earth]361-earth]1591-the most handsome of all men on earth , [the finest singer]1593-the finest singer and [the best drummer]1594-the best drummer . When [he]92-imodoye drummed smoke rose in the air , and when [he]92-imodoye sang flames

danced out of [his]92-imodoye mouth ; [his]92-imodoye favourite music was the music

of incantations . The fifth was [Elegbede - Ode]95-elegbede . [He]92-imodoye was [a human child]1595-a human child but had lived to maturity among wild animals , for when [he]92-imodoye was born [he]92-imodoye had three eyes , one at the back of [his]92-imodoye head .

This led [[his]92-imodoye mother]1449-his mother to cast [him]92-imodoye in [the bush]1295-the bush , and there it was

[he]92-imodoye began to live among [baboons]1598-baboons and grew immensely strong .

After a while [he]92-imodoye returned to [town]1471-town and lived in [the palace]893-the palace , but [his]92-imodoye

nature was unruly , like [the baboons]1601-the baboons , and this was what made [men]189-men refer to [him]92-imodoye as [Elegbede]95-elegbede - [Ode]95-elegbede , for [Elegbede]95-elegbede is [the father

of [the baboon]1604-the baboon]1603-the father of the baboon . [He]92-imodoye stayed a long while with [the king]381-the king , [the

king]381-the king bought [him]92-imodoye a gun and [he]92-imodoye turned to hunting . [He]92-imodoye under-

stood the language of birds and the language of beasts , and

was stronger than a lion . If [you]1607-you hit [him]92-imodoye [he]92-imodoye felt it not ,

if [you]1607-you knocked [him]92-imodoye down [he]92-imodoye did not care at all ; nor did

an iron rod have the slightest effect on [him]92-imodoye . The sixth was

called [Efoiye]96-efoiye . [He]96-efoiye was not [a native of [[our]1609-our town]356-our town]1608-a native of our town at all and [I]0-i had never met [him]96-efoiye until the matter of [Mount Langbodo]97-mount langbodo raised its head . [He]92-imodoye was [an archer]1611-an archer and [he]92-imodoye really belonged

to [the family of birds]1612-the family of birds , for instead of hairs [he]92-imodoye had little

feathers growing from [his]92-imodoye body . [He]92-imodoye plucked them out all

the time to avoid the jeers of [people]1613-people but whenever [he]92-imodoye was fully clothed [no one]227-no one could see [them]1615-them . [He]92-imodoye brought [his]92-imodoye wings

into use only when deadly danger threatened [him]92-imodoye on [his]92-imodoye

hunts . Wherever [Efoiye]96-efoiye sent [his]96-efoiye arrow there it went unfailingly .

Even if [he]96-efoiye did not see [the quarry]1616-the quarry it was enough that [he]96-efoiye ordered

[his]96-efoiye bow to hunt it down and this it did without failing . But

[he]96-efoiye was forbidden to shoot more than seven arrows a day if [he]96-efoiye

wished to avoid the wrath of [Sokoti]74-sokoti , [the Heavenly Smith]1617-the heavenly smith ,

79

whose present the bow was to [[Efoiye]96-efoiye 's father]1618-efoiye 's father . [The seventh]1619-the seventh

was [the Miraculous Man]1620-the miraculous man , [Aramada - okunrin]98-aramada - okunrin , [a relation of

[He]1620-the miraculous man was [a most singular man]1623-a most singular man , for when [he]1620-the miraculous man was under the sun or inside fire , [he]1620-the miraculous man would feel

cold , but whenever the weather turned cold , [he]1620-the miraculous man sweated from heat ; everything about [him]1620-the miraculous man was the wrong way round .

So [we]1624-we were quite [a strange gathering who set out on this

great expedition]1625-a strange gathering who set out on this great expedition ; when [we]1624-we were all paraded before [him]1620-the miraculous man , [the

From the wealth of [my]0-i knowledge and experience [I]0-i know that

forget [us]1624-we . And so [I]0-i greet [you]1657-you on behalf of all [[my]0-i comrades]1380-my comrades ,

' [[My]1666-his comrades who go now to [Mount Langbodo]97-mount langbodo]2968-my comrades who go now to mount langbodo , make [your]2968-my comrades who go now to mount langbodo minds resolute and act like [men of strength]2969-men of strength . ess that will compare with that of a man of steel]2971-an indolent man poss- ess that will compare with that of a man of steel ? [I]0-i want [you]1670-you to understand that the skull of [a lazy man]1671-a lazy man is not worth the

[Imodoye]92-imodoye 's manner of speaking was very effective and it

steeled [our]1676-we hearts . Together [we]1676-we all declared , ' [We]1676-we shall fulfil [our]1676-we[1676-we]

head , it takes five fingers to lift the food to the mouth — make [your]1682-you counsel one . From this day on , do not remember [[your]1682-you homes]1683-your homes , follow the route which leads to [your]1682-you destination ,

;

watch only where [you]1682-you are bound . If wild animals attack [you]1682-you , fight them off , if [evil spirits]1684-evil spirits trouble [you]1682-you , trouble [them]1684-evil spirits in turn ,

and when [you]1682-you are finally by [yourselves]1682-you always re - assess [your]1682-you plans . [I]0-i will not recount all [our]1686-we experiences before [we]1686-we crossed [the

mention briefly something of [the kingdom of ghommids]1689-the kingdom of ghommids whose ruler was [[my]0-i good friend]516-my good friend . [I]0-i told [you]1682-you [his]1685-that old man story yesterday , told

[you]1682-you how [we]1686-we met on [my]0-i second sojourn in [the Forest]201-the forest ; it was in the place where [I]0-i killed the one - eyed leopard . [We]1686-we called

on [[his]1685-that old man kingdom]1692-his kingdom again and [he]1685-that old man took very good care of [us]1686-we , even providing plenty of food for [our]1686-we journey . [He]1685-that old man told [me]0-i also

that the dog which [I]0-i was accused of stealing was not dead that it was [[my]0-i enemies]1693-my enemies who took and hid it , in order to

create an occasion to triumph over [me]0-i .

[Our]1686-we plans accomplished in [the Forest of Irunmale]28-the forest of irunmale , [we]1686-we set

[our]1686-we heads on [the road to [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo]1694-the road to mount langbodo , and then , a mem- orable event took place . It happened thus : suddenly [we]1686-we were

surrounded by a dense thicket and the trail vanished from [our]1686-we

sight ; [we]1686-we could turn neither left nor right , the thicket was like

a solid fence and [I]0-i doubt if a mouse could have found an open-

ing for escape . [We]1686-we endeavoured to hack a way through this

bush but the stalks grew back as soon as they were cut , and in

the end [we]1686-we surrendered [ourselves]1686-we to death and dared what-

ever would happen to do its worst . But , in the evening of the

third night of [our]1686-we confinement to [this one spot]1695-this one spot , [we]1686-we noticed two big birds fly in and land on a tree quite close to [us]1686-we . [Kako]89-kako raised

[his]89-kako gun to shoot at [them]1696-them but was stopped by [Elegbede - Ode]95-elegbede ,

and after a while [Elegbede]95-elegbede [himself]95-elegbede aimed [his]89-kako gun and shot one

of [them]1696-them . Do not forget that [Elegbede]95-elegbede could understand the

82

language of beasts , and it was the content of [their]1696-them talk which

made [him]89-kako stay [Kako]89-kako 's hand . One of the birds — the very one

which [Elegbede]95-elegbede shot — had been saying to the other that [Kako]89-kako was the cause of [our]1686-we present predicament and that [the occa-

sion]1697-the occa- sion for it was [the guiltless woman whom [he]89-kako had killed in [the

Great Forest]1496-the great forest some days before , for [this woman]607-this woman had cried for

redress to heaven]1698-the guiltless woman whom he had killed in the great forest some days before , for this woman had cried for redress to heaven . [The bird]1701-the bird said also that unless [he]89-kako was killed

and sacrificed and used in a rite of appeasement for the terrible

sin of [Kako]89-kako , [God]72-god would not relent towards [us]1686-we and [we]1686-we would never emerge from [our]1686-we imprisonment . This was why [Elegbede]95-elegbede

killed the bird . According to [our]1686-we own usage , [we]1686-we split the bird

open and poured oil in it ; [we]1686-we placed it in a small potsherd and left it at the foot of a large tree nearby . The heart of [God]72-god soft-

cause [he]89-kako knew that [we]1686-we would worship [him]89-kako in a more befitting

manner if only [we]1686-we had a better understanding than this .

Shortly afterwards [I]0-i had an inspiration . [I]0-i remembered the

woman who had rescued [me]0-i from [Agbako]65-agbako 's clutches the other

[earth]361-earth and performed the rites as [a seasoned hunter]1704-a seasoned hunter . Shortly

[Iranlowo]104-iranlowo listened to everything ; when [I]0-i was done [she]104-iranlowo bade [us]1707-we follow [her]104-iranlowo , and so [we]1707-we did . All the growth that surrounded [us]1707-we began to part before [us]1707-we as [we]1707-we moved forward . Soon [we]1707-we were

once again on [the road to [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo]1694-the road to mount langbodo and [she]1708-her turned

[We]1707-we did not journey much after this before it was night and [we]1707-we slept . Hardly had [the cuckoo]1711-the cuckoo cried the following dawn be-

fore [we]1707-we were up and setting [our]1707-we feet on [the road]472-the road , nor did [we]1707-we encounter any danger until about half past ten when [we]1707-we saw [a man before [us]1707-we whose name was [Fear]105-fear , [Eru]106-eru]1713-a man before us whose name was fear , eru .

When [we]1707-we saw [the man]212-the man [we]1707-we were truly afraid , for [this man]600-this man had four heads : one was human enough and faced [the East]19-the east ;

the second was like the head of a lion and was turned to [the

West]39-the west ; the third was a serpent 's , its tongue darted incessantly

and spouted venom — this was to [the North]1716-the north , and the fourth was

the head of a poisonous fish from whose mouth flared huge

flames — and this was turned southwards . Myriad snakes were

coiled around [his]600-this man neck and innumerable scorpions had made [his]600-this man shoulders [their]1717-their home : [he]600-this man was excessively hairy . Wasps and stinging bees flew round [him]600-this man in thousands and [he]600-this man caressed

them as [he]600-this man walked . At [his]600-this man approach , a great gust blew and [the forest]201-the forest was filled with noises , both timber and palm raised

shouts of , ' Fear comes to the head of [the disobedient]2975-the disobedient , [he]600-this man[600-this man]

is a sword in the hand of [God]72-god to cut away the stubborn lest

[Kako]89-kako and [Elegbede]95-elegbede moved towards [him]600-this man to join battle with

and bees . [They]1719-they made many attempts but all to no avail .

[each one of [us]1707-we]1720-each one of us made trial of [our]1707-we various powers but nothing

thunder resounded and smoke gushed from the face of hea-

ven — this was why [our]1838-we buttocks turned to water from fear ,

and [I]0-i nearly excreted in [my]0-i trousers . When eventually [he]212-the man [him-]212-the man self appeared in the distance , [his]212-the man eyes were as kernels , and the

breath from [his]212-the man nostrils like steam from boiling water . [He]212-the man came towards [us]1838-we and [Kako]89-kako in turn advanced on [him]212-the man ; [they]1843-they met and [they]1843-they began to fight . [His]212-the man thought was to rip [Kako]89-kako in pieces in

one second but the affair was not to be as [he]212-the man thought ; [Kako]89-kako in turn also planned to tear [him]212-the man apart . [They]1843-they wrestled until dust

rose to smother the skies and [we]1838-we could not see [them]1843-they both clearly — alas , that day 's fight can not be recounted fully in a

book for time is flying . After a long time [Were - Orun]112-were - orun grew furious for [he]112-were - orun had never fought with [a man like [Kako]89-kako]1844-a man like kako . [He]112-were - orun spat

on [his]112-were - orun hands and when [he]112-were - orun had muttered an incantation [he]112-were - orun rub-

bed the spit on [his]112-were - orun head and instantly [his]112-were - orun body was engulfed in

flames so that [Kako]89-kako retreated fast and could not hold on to

[him]112-were - orun . This angered [Elegbede]95-elegbede - [Ode]95-elegbede and [Aramada]98-aramada - okunrin [the Miraculous Man]1620-the miraculous man and [they]1843-they both rushed on [the man]212-the man and began to fight [him]212-the man , but before long [Elegbede]95-elegbede could bear the heat no longer and [he]212-the man retreated . But [Aramada]98-aramada - okunrin felt nothing for [his]212-the man nature was differ-

ent ; the more [he]212-the man fought the colder [he]212-the man felt . Before long the fire

91

was such that [we]1847-we could see neither of [them]1843-they , [they]1843-they were wholly

[It]1848-it burnt for about two hours before [it]1848-it died , and when it

behaviour angered the birds and [they]1843-they attacked [us]1847-we , and when [I]0-i observed that [they]1843-they seemed to be getting the better of [us]1847-we [I]0-i

took out one of the pods which the gnom had given [me]0-i on [my]0-i last adventure , broke it , and passed one pepper apiece to [[my]0-i comrades]1380-my comrades , swallowing one [myself]0-i . The moment these peppers

and during it [we]1847-we lost [Janduku]114-janduku [the junior brother of [Kako]89-kako]1856-the junior brother of kako and [[Ojuri]115-ojuri the brother of [Imodoye]92-imodoye]1857-ojuri the brother of imodoye . still on the wing . [We]1847-we had flown for some time when [Kako]89-kako suggested that [we]1847-we return to walking on [our]1847-we feet , for flying

tell [you]1878-you everything , so [I]0-i will mention just one more episode .

One morning , as [we]1847-we made [our]1847-we way along , [I]0-i caught sight of

[a man who went by the name of [Egbin]116-egbin]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin . In fact [we]1847-we began to

smell [him]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin even before [we]1847-we set eyes on [him]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin . [[My]0-i good friends]808-my good friends ,

since the day [I]0-i was born into [this world]272-this world [I]0-i have never encoun-

tered such a disgusting object as [this man]600-this man . All [his]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin toes were

pocked with the jigger and they were so numerous that they

had cut through several of [his]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin toes and infested [his]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin legs from the soles to the knees and many of them even came out of

[their]1883-their own accord as [he]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin walked . The sores on [his]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin legs were

numerous and [he]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin covered them with broad leaves , for the

smallest of them was at least the size of [my]0-i palm , many of them were left uncovered because these leaves could not

fully cope with their size and they oozed fluids and pus as

[he]1879-a man who went by the name of egbin moved . [Egbin]116-egbin never cleaned [his]116-egbin anus when [he]116-egbin excreted

and crusts of excrement from some three years back could

be found at the entrance to [[his]116-egbin anus]1884-his anus ; when [he]116-egbin rested , worms and piles emerged from [his]116-egbin anus and sauntered all over [his]116-egbin

body , and [he]116-egbin would pull them off with [his]116-egbin hands ; when [he]116-egbin

wanted to excrete [he]116-egbin never stopped in one spot , [he]116-egbin voided

as [he]116-egbin walked and the faeces stuck to [his]116-egbin thighs and stuck to

[his]116-egbin legs . Every kind of boil and tumour lined the body of [this

man]600-this man and each one was bigger than [my]0-i foot , they burst open on [his]116-egbin body and [he]116-egbin would gather the suppuration in [his]116-egbin hand and lick it up . [Egbin]116-egbin never bathed , it was taboo . The oozing

from [his]116-egbin eyes was like the vomit of [a man who has eaten

corn porridge , [he]116-egbin stank worse than rotten meat and maggots filled [his]116-egbin flesh]1886-a man who has eaten corn porridge , he stank worse than rotten meat and maggots filled his flesh . [His]116-egbin hair was as the skin of a toad , grime from eternities was plastered on it , black [he]116-egbin was as soap from palm oil . Earthworms , snakes , scorpions and every manner of

crawly creatures came out from [his]116-egbin mouth when [he]116-egbin spoke

and [he]116-egbin would chew on them whenever [he]116-egbin was hungry . The mucus never dried in [Egbin]116-egbin 's nostrils , this [he]116-egbin used as water

for cooking [his]116-egbin food and [he]116-egbin drank it also as water . [[My]0-i friends]180-my friends ,

In the beginning of [the world]206-the world , after the creation of [Adam]122-adam and [Eve]123-eve [[our]1961-our first father]1962-our first father and [mother]1170-mother , the intention of [the

Creator]1801-the creator was that after [these children]1965-these children were brought to [him]1801-the creator [he]1801-the creator

would breathe life into [them]1965-these children , and thereafter order that [they]1965-these children

be fitted with the smock of immortality in [the home of [Ogodo-]124-ogodo-]1966-the home of ogodo- go , for the dresses in [[his]1801-the creator house]1967-his house are varied ; there are those of

immortality and there are others of mortality . And the

advantage that this would have brought [us]1961-our is that [we]1961-our of [this

world]272-this world could not die , and [[our]1961-our grandfathers]1969-our grandfathers and [mothers]1970-mothers would also be alive today . Certain it is also that the wisdom of [the

world]206-the world would be greater ; the mighty stone structures which exist in [Egypt]41-egypt till this day which were the brainwork of

several generations past , and many other works of marvel

which still astonish [the world]206-the world and which those who preceded

forefathers]1974-our forefathers committed changed [the Creator]1801-the creator 's mind for [him]1801-the creator instead of immortality [he]1801-the creator ordered that [the children who were

destined for]1976-the children who were destined for [this world]272-this world should put on the smock of mortality

so that [the world]206-the world would be one of taste - it - but - not - swallow

for [them]1976-the children who were destined for . But on the day that [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje was due for [his]120-iragbeje own smock and [he]120-iragbeje went to [the house of [Ogodogo]121-ogodogo]1979-the house of ogodogo to be fitted , [he]120-iragbeje

did not meet [the man]212-the man at [home]199-home and , rather than await [his]120-iragbeje

return , [he]120-iragbeje entered [the clothes store]1982-the clothes store , helped [himself]120-iragbeje to one of

immortality and fled into [earth]361-earth . And , even though [God]72-god did

not expect [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje to behave in this manner , nevertheless ,

according to the course which [God]72-god had [himself]72-god plotted , the

immortal fittings which were in [the home of [Ogodogo]121-ogodogo]1984-the home of ogodogo had such predominance over life that [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje can not die , for the

smock itself is what [God]72-god 's own unique creations wear on [the

outskirts of heaven]1985-the outskirts of heaven .

99

And so it is that [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje lives in [the world]206-the world but does not

die ; that [his]120-iragbeje eyes have seen much in [the world]206-the world and the wisdom of [earth]361-earth is clear to [him]120-iragbeje . But after a while [he]120-iragbeje grew tired of [[our]1989-you

world]1990-our world and [he]120-iragbeje came to [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo where [he]120-iragbeje could em- ploy the manifold wisdoms of [his]120-iragbeje mind .

[The house where [he]120-iragbeje lived]1991-the house where he lived had seven wings , and the name of [the house]226-the house was in fact [The House with Seven Wings]1993-the house with seven wings ; [he]120-iragbeje

lived in [one wing]1994-one wing every day of the week ; when [he]120-iragbeje stayed

in one today , [he]120-iragbeje stayed in the other tomorrow . And on the

day of [our]1989-you entry into [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo , [the king]381-the king sent to let

[him]120-iragbeje know that [we]1989-you were coming to live with [him]120-iragbeje for seven

days . On that day itself , however , it was in [the palace]893-the palace that

[we]1989-you slept .

THE FIRST DAY WITH [IRAGBEJE]120-iragbeje IN [THE HOUSE WITH SEVEN WINGS]1993-the house with seven wings

On the second day , [the king]381-the king ordered that [[his]381-the king servants]1941-his servants take

[us]1989-you to [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje , and when [we]1989-you arrived [he]381-the king took [us]1989-you to [a large room at the very end of [the house]226-the house]2000-a large room at the very end of the house . [[My]0-i dear comrades]2002-my dear comrades , [this room [we]1989-you speak of]2003-this room we speak of was of exceeding beauty ; [its]2003-this room we speak of floor was laid with the

most precious stones , it shone like a mirror and was bright

as a rockpool . In fact when [we]1989-you first entered [it]2003-this room we speak of [we]1989-you thought

that [it]2003-this room we speak of had been built in the middle of [a lake]2004-a lake : the truth was that reflections from the stones created this illusion — ah , [a

most impressive man]2005-a most impressive man is [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje .

There was a great variety of seats in [this room]661-this room and each one

glittered like the lightning of heaven . When [we]1989-you entered [the

room]503-the room and were seated , [Iragbeje]120-iragbeje sat on the tallest of these chairs ;

[we]1989-you turned [our]1989-you chairs to face [him]120-iragbeje and [he]120-iragbeje began to address

tention and eating ten hunks of meat at one sitting .

Remember that [the world]206-the world is inconstant and that [you]1989-you may become [a poor man]2035-a poor man tomorrow , when a halfpenny will prove

into eternal debt . [A man]259-a man lives according to [his]259-a man means . hands]2068-a hardened thief in your 102 hands and [an inmate of [prisons]2070-prisons]2069-an inmate of prisons after tomorrow . If [you]1989-you have

The ridicule itself is however the smallest part of it , what fol-

lows a hundred and twenty far exceeds a hundred and forty ;

the name which [[your]1989-you child]2019-your child now bears is worse than it was at the

beginning , [he]2019-your child is now [a half - educated person]2076-a half - educated person . [The half - educated]2077-the half - educated

feels ashamed to take up [his]2077-the half - educated cutlass , yet the amount of book- learning in [his]2077-the half - educated head is not enough to earn [him]2077-the half - educated a living ; [the

half - educated]2077-the half - educated wants to wear shoes yet [his]2077-the half - educated salary can hardly buy [him]2077-the half - educated a buba , therefore understand that if [you]1989-you can not take it

through to the end it is no compulsory matter : teach [[your]1989-you child]2019-your child

some useful trade . If it is farming , let [him]2019-your child learn it well ; see for

[yourself]1989-you how [the black nations]2080-the black nations are rich in land , it is a gift from [[their]2080-the black nations Creator]159-their creator to [[their]2080-the black nations great ancestors]2082-their great ancestors ; if it is trading , teach [him]2019-your child soundly , and if it is road - building , let [him]2019-your child understand it tho-

roughly . Let [him]2019-your child not learn a little of this and a little of that ,

jumping from one thing to the other , as [a man who chases two mice]2083-a man who chases two mice at once surely catches nothing . This is [your]1989-you time , prepare

and is [herself]2084-your mother useless as [a person]2085-a person . " [I]0-i want [you]1989-you to know that

;

and the sun by night , the wisdom of [the old]2091-the old can not desert [the

how is it ? Have [you]1989-you forgotten [[your]1989-you mother]2084-your mother ? Or do [you]1989-you not

and pulled at anyhow , even biting them , and it was on [her]2084-your mother

repent in time [they]2152-children who are even so bold are asking for [the ostrich of God]2156-the ostrich of god to pluck

crate [your]2157-you name ; the curse of [parents]2163-parents when [the child]1070-the child is guilty

never fails to hunt down [the child]1070-the child .

' [I]2157-you have spoken much about [children]1122-children but [I]2157-you have not yet told[2157-you]

[you]2157-you about [the Ajantala type of child]2166-the ajantala type of child , [those whose behaviour is

turbulent and whose very nature is turbulence itself]2167-those whose behaviour is turbulent and whose very nature is turbulence itself . [I]0-i will not

talk much about [them]2166-the ajantala type of child , [I]0-i will simply tell [you]2157-you a little story , a

most enjoyable story it is , highly entertaining . This is how it

goes :

' Once [a woman]562-a woman gave birth to [a child]804-a child , [a very beautiful child]3001-a very beautiful child ,[2169-he]

but no sooner was [the child born]2168-the child born than [he]2169-he began speaking out

loud in these words , " Ha ! is this how [the world]206-the world is ? Why did

[I]0-i ever come [here]693-here ? [I]0-i had no idea it was such [a rotten place]2172-a rotten place .

[I]0-i thought [the world]206-the world would be as spotless as [heaven]276-heaven ! Ha ! Just

look at [the pit]1135-the pit and look at [the mound]2176-the mound ! Look at the cow - dung

in [the middle of [the town]308-the town]2177-the middle of the town ! Look at dirt in the open . [I]0-i have

surely had it , [I]0-i wo n't be long returning to [heaven]276-heaven , no doubt

about that . " [[My]0-i brave hunters]2180-my brave hunters , it was a baby born that very

day who spoke thus , and no sooner had [he]2169-he spoken than [he]2169-he

rose from the spot on which [he]2169-he had been delivered , permitting

[no one]227-no one to carry [him]2169-he , entered [[[his]2169-he mother]1449-his mother 's room]2183-his mother 's room and took from

it sponge and soap , scrubbed [himself]2169-he gleaming , wrapped a

cloth around [himself]2169-he and sat at a tense crouch . Not long after

[he]2169-he turned again into [the house]226-the house and before [he]2169-he re - emerged [he]2169-he

ate six large wraps of eko ; [he]2169-he would have eaten more but there

was none left in [the house]226-the house . And as [he]2169-he emerged it was a cry of

hunger which preceded [him]2169-he ; these goings - on were a wonder

to [the whole town]2186-the whole town .

' Before long [the townspeople]828-the townspeople had heard and begun to arrive[2187-themselves]

to see for [themselves]2187-themselves , but [the child]1070-the child did not take kindly to [them]2187-themselves .

106

On the seventh day , when it was time to give [him]1070-the child a name , [the

parents]2189-the parents filled [the house]226-the house with drinks and food spilled onto [the

road]472-the road , and when the moment came to name [him]1070-the child , [he]1070-the child [himself]1070-the child an-

nounced , " [My]0-i name is [Ajantala]126-ajantala " . From the moment that pre-

parations began for the feast on this day [we]2192-we speak of , [Ajantala]126-ajantala

had been simmering inside and , after a while , [he]126-ajantala entered [the

enclosure where the cooking was taking place]2193-the enclosure where the cooking was taking place , seized the ladle

and began to stir the stew on the fire ; this flabbergasted [those

who witnessed it]2194-those who witnessed it , and [they]2194-those who witnessed it said , " [The plantain]2195-the plantain shoot kills [the

plantain]2195-the plantain ; [Ajantala]126-ajantala will be the death of [[his]126-ajantala mother]1449-his mother . " Such words of provocation to [Ajantala]126-ajantala ! [He]126-ajantala seized a whip and thrashed [all

those who were busy about the food]2198-all those who were busy about the food and scattered [them]2198-all those who were busy about the food . And [his]126-ajantala

anger was further inflamed against [the others who sat feasting]2199-the others who sat feasting ,

[he]126-ajantala waded into [them]2199-the others who sat feasting and nearly flogged [them]2199-the others who sat feasting to death ; [some well - muscled grown - ups]2200-some well - muscled grown - ups tried to face up to [him]126-ajantala but [his]126-ajantala strength

was more than [theirs]2200-some well - muscled grown - ups . In the end [everyone]883-everyone commenced a rapid

dialogue with [his]883-everyone feet , calling on [[their]883-everyone gods]2202-their gods for rescue : [the

Christians]768-the christians called to [[their]768-the christians Saviour]2204-their saviour , [the Moslems]767-the moslems called [Anobi]127-anobi ,

[the masqueraders]2206-the masqueraders called on [[their]2206-the masqueraders ancestors]2207-their ancestors , [Sango followers]2208-sango followers

called on [Sango]69-sango , [Oloya]128-oloya called on [Oya]70-oya . Ah , it was a most inaus-

picious day for [the revellers]2209-the revellers , the confusion was great indeed .

When [Ajantala]126-ajantala had had enough of the chase [he]126-ajantala returned [home]199-home and began to hiss , muttering , " Do [you]2211-you say [you]2211-you have no sense ,

[I]0-i will teach [you]2211-you all sense . " Even as [he]126-ajantala spoke [he]126-ajantala entered [[[his]126-ajantala

mother]1449-his mother 's room]2183-his mother 's room and smashed six plates ; as [he]126-ajantala came out [he]126-ajantala

trampled six fowls to death . [A man who stood by]2214-a man who stood by said , " Ah , [[you]126-ajantala child]2215-you child , what [a cruel one]2216-a cruel one [you]126-ajantala are ! " [Ajantala]126-ajantala exploded six

slaps in [the man]212-the man 's face and , when [he]126-ajantala and [the man]212-the man began to

fight , [a passer - by]2219-a passer - by tried to separate [them]2220-them and [Ajantala]126-ajantala gave

[the man]212-the man six kicks . When [he]126-ajantala had done with kicking , [he]126-ajantala saw [some men]2222-some men playing ayo ; [he]126-ajantala deserted the fight , joined [the players]2223-the players

at [their]2223-the players game , and defeated [them]2223-the players six times . [[His]126-ajantala elder brother]2942-his elder brother

who had observed all these happenings , opened [his]2942-his elder brother mouth and exclaimed , " Ha ! " and [his]2942-his elder brother mouth tore wide open right to the

back of [his]2942-his elder brother head . [Ajantala]126-ajantala had become a big problem .

107

' [[My]126-ajantala strong friends]3003-my strong friends , thus did [this wonder child]3004-this wonder child conduct [himself]3004-this wonder child with violence for a solid month and become a terror[126-ajantala]

to [the whole town]2186-the whole town and a peril to [the public]2226-the public , yet [no one]227-no one could

' There was [a babalawo]3005-a babalawo in [this town]586-this town , [a most experienced[126-ajantala]

that of [six grown - ups]2240-six grown - ups , formidable . [No one]227-no one could dine with

while [one]179-one foraged for food , [the others]803-the others stayed at [home]199-home , and when the food was brought [they]2274-them all shared in it . Thus had [they]2274-them lived for a long time without any misunderstanding ,

that is , until [this pestilential child]2279-this pestilential child came among [them]2274-them . [He]2279-this pestilential child arrived in [this place]728-this place on an evening when it was the turn of

that [Ajantala]126-ajantala was not [himself]126-ajantala taller than a foot and a half ) .

road]472-the road in full flight . When [they]2286-the other creatures had gone some distance [Goat]133-goat felt a little hungry , so , planning to steal a little of the food in

[their]2286-the other creatures load , [he]133-goat told [the rest]2302-the rest that [he]133-goat needed to stop and empty

' [Goat]133-goat took up the load and stepped out livelily . Shortly[133-goat]

red to [Hyena]135-hyena , and soon [he]135-hyena also wanted to empty [his]135-hyena bowels

of fictitious excrement . The beating which [Ajantala]126-ajantala gave [him]135-hyena was generous , [no one]227-no one had ever dealt [him]135-hyena such punishment before . [He]135-hyena wanted to cry out but [Ajantala]126-ajantala choked [him]135-hyena , yet

this [Ajantala]126-ajantala was no more than a mere stump . [Hyena]135-hyena begged and begged for mercy but [Ajantala]126-ajantala did not spare [him]135-hyena until

113

Even so did [this wondrous child]2310-this wondrous child beat [them]2311-they all , one after

the other . The last was [Elephant]132-elephant and , when [Ajantala]126-ajantala had got a grip on [him]132-elephant , [Elephant]132-elephant took to [his]132-elephant heels and [Ajantala]126-ajantala

sped after in pursuit . Before long [they]2311-they had caught up with

[the travellers in front]2312-the travellers in front and [Elephant]132-elephant and [the others]803-the others shook the

fluff of speed as one might worry out cotton ; the matter became " if [you]2314-you wo n't move , clear out of [my]0-i way ! " [Each one of [them]2311-they]2315-each one of them gave voice to different cries , [Goat]133-goat cried " Mme - e - e ! " , [Hyena]135-hyena wailed , the voice of [Leopard]136-leopard shook the ground , [Lion]134-lion rumbled like a rainstorm , and [Elephant]132-elephant trumpeted .

' In the end [Ajantala]126-ajantala took a short cut to await [them]2311-they ahead ,[126-ajantala]

and sure enough [he]126-ajantala came out on [the road]472-the road ahead of [them]2311-they .

[He]126-ajantala chose a large tree which was by the roadside and climbed

up on it , hoping that when [they]2311-they came beneath it [they]2311-they would be tempted to rest . Not long afterwards [they]2311-they all arrived in

headlong disorder , and when [they]2311-they came to the tree [they]2311-they decid-

ed to stop and rest , saying that it was quite some time since

[they]2311-they last saw signs of [Ajantala]126-ajantala . If only [they]2311-they knew it , [he]126-ajantala was right above [them]2311-they .

' While [they]2311-they were resting , [they]2311-they began to talk and to revile[126-ajantala]

tala]129-ajan- tala 's admission into [[their]2311-they household]2321-their household . [Goat]133-goat said , " Ha , it

' When [the father of a certain man]3027-the father of a certain man died , [he]3027-the father of a certain man left [him]3027-the father of a certain man a hundred pounds . [The man]212-the man used all this money to buy several sorts of[0-i]

delicate goods , all breakable things like jars , drinking glasses ,

all kinds of flasks , mirrors ; a variety of dining plates and sim-

ilar objects in which [he]2433-the fox wanted to trade . One morning [he]2433-the fox

arranged all these things in a pile before [him]2433-the fox and , when [he]2433-the fox had revelled in the sight , [he]2433-the fox felt very happy and began to think

aloud : " This hundred pounds of [mine]2433-the fox is no chicken feed . Is it

not the amount [I]0-i spent in buying these goods ? Surely , if [I]0-i sell

[them]2460-them , [I]0-i will make a profit of another hundred pounds and [my]0-i wealth will become two hundred . And if [I]0-i trade with this also ,

121

will it not become four hundred pounds ? Surely if [I]0-i have four

hundred pounds [I]0-i am truly in the money . How quickly does

[a man]259-a man become rich ! If [I]0-i use this again to trade [I]0-i will soon gain

another four hundred pounds , and by such imperceptible

means the amount now stands at eight hundred . But if [I]0-i own eight hundred pounds have [I]0-i not truly arrived ? Immediately

[all men]1728-all men will sound [my]0-i fame . Even then , the eight hundred pounds need not remain so , suppose [I]0-i traded again with it ?

Surely it will yield more profit and a mighty profit at that , so

[my]0-i current standing could rise from this to some two thousand

pounds . As [a man worth two thousand]2463-a man worth two thousand , [the entire town]933-the entire town will

have heard of [me]0-i , [my]0-i word will be law , but even if [I]0-i owned this sum [I]0-i would not stop there , [I]0-i would trade until the two thousand pounds had become four , then eight , and so on up until [I]0-i owned ten thousand pounds in ten thousand places .

If [I]0-i owned ten thousand pounds in ten thousand places it is

only left for [me]0-i to feast and dress gorgeously and parade [[my-]0-i self]2465-my- self that [everyone]883-everyone may salute [me]0-i in honour . However , [a man]259-a man uses money to seek money ; before [I]0-i rest on [my]0-i laurels [I]0-i ought

to trade just a little more , so if [I]0-i used this sum to buy more goods [I]0-i should approach ten thousand thousand pounds in ten thousand thousand places . Only now would [I]0-i rest

and take [me]0-i [a wife]2468-a wife . But who should [I]0-i marry in [this town]586-this town ? Nothing less than [a princess]2470-a princess would do . When [I]0-i have taken [her]2470-a princess

to [wife]295-wife and [she]2470-a princess has moved into [[my]0-i house]583-my house , [I]0-i shall treat [her]2470-a princess with

disdain — is [she]2470-a princess not [[my]0-i wife]1249-my wife ? [I]0-i married [her]2470-a princess with [my]0-i wealth and ,

[princess]2474-princess though [she]2470-a princess is , it is [my]0-i money which has brought [her]2470-a princess

to [me]0-i ; or has [anyone]282-anyone seen [me]0-i approach [[[her]2470-a princess father]2476-her father 's palace]2477-her father 's palace to

' A human fault is had - [I]138-tears - but - known and [no one]227-no one can totally[138-tears]

' About acts of kindness , it is true that [men]189-men ought to perform these , but [a man]259-a man ought to know what sort of kindness [he]2492-he ought[0-i]

' One day [a man]259-a man was journeying to [a foreign land]3035-a foreign land and , as [he]2018-one man[2018-one man]

reached [the neighbourhood of [a certain town]1741-a certain town]2502-the neighbourhood of a certain town , [he]2018-one man saw [a leo-

pard]2504-a leo- pard in an iron cage . [This cage]2505-this cage was a snare set by [the people of

[the town]308-the town]2506-the people of the town to trap the leopard which had been molesting [them]2506-the people of the town .

[The cage]2508-the cage had been constructed in such a way that , once [the leo-

pard]2509-the leo- pard had entered [it]2508-the cage , [he]2018-one man could not free [himself]2018-one man unless the cage

was opened by [some other person]2510-some other person .

' When [the leopard]3036-the leopard saw [the man]212-the man [he]212-the man pleaded with [him]212-the man to set[2510-some other person]

[him]2018-one man free , but [the man]212-the man said no . [He]212-the man begged and begged [this man]600-this man to release [him]212-the man until eventually [he]212-the man said , " How is it ? What have

[I]0-i ever done to [you]600-this man ? [You]600-this man think only of today , [you]600-this man do not con-

sider tomorrow . True , [the whole world]2513-the whole world calls [me]0-i [a wicked brute]2514-a wicked brute

but [I]0-i know that [I]0-i am a kindly animal . [You]600-this man know [yourself]600-this man that

the tongue of [mankind]434-mankind is most inconstant , the same tongue

that praises [a man]259-a man also reviles [him]259-a man , and if [you]600-this man were to live with

[no other companion but [me]0-i]2517-no other companion but me , [I]0-i [the incomparable leopard ,

noble of [the jungle depths]2519-the jungle depths , who raises [children]1122-children without pinch-

tain am [I]0-i that the eye will not fail to encounter the body after . "

' When [the man]212-the man heard all this [he]212-the man said , " It is the truth [you]600-this man[600-this man]

' The leopard answered [him]600-this man , " If it is only this matter that[600-this man]

to state [his]212-the man case , telling [him]212-the man how on [his]212-the man journey [he]212-the man had seen

laughter

' " Salutations leopard , [you]3036-the leopard have truly had it now , [you]3036-the leopard will[2433-the fox]

long remain there , [you]3036-the leopard who make [men]189-men tire of kindness , the

riverside crow will surely pluck out those charitable eyes

of [yours]3036-the leopard . Go [your]3036-the leopard own way [[my]0-i good man]2635-my good man and do n't forget

the fowls which [you]3036-the leopard promised [me]0-i . When [you]3036-the leopard reach [town]1471-town tell

[the people]977-the people that the leopard which pestered [them]977-the people has now been caged , let [them]977-the people come with arrows and with guns , with bows and with full quivers , to give [this ingrate]2638-this ingrate [his]2638-this ingrate recom- pense . "

129

' Thus was the leopard hoist with [his]2638-this ingrate own petard , [he]2638-this ingrate thought and thought but could find no way out , the fox needled [him]2638-this ingrate with six hundred jibes and [the man]212-the man with seven hundred . to [his]2638-this ingrate body , [his]2638-this ingrate eyes blinked with rapidity , outwitted [he]2638-this ingrate was and hopelessly floundering . [The man]212-the man did as the fox advised

[him]212-the man and , before long , [the people of [the town]308-the town]2506-the people of the town arrived and slaughtered [him]212-the man . As [he]212-the man was dying [he]212-the man said , " Ah , is this how miserably [I]0-i end ! If only [I]0-i had used the grace which [God]72-god gave [me]0-i in a fitting manner , this would not have happened to [me]0-i . "

' Even so did the leopard regret [his]212-the man sin , but it was too late ;[212-the man]

true , [he]212-the man repented , but the matter was already at the conclu-

sion , [he]212-the man stuck the finger of had - [I]0-i - but - known in [his]212-the man mouth and awaited what would be [his]212-the man fate . May [God]72-god protect [us]2642-we

from such belated regrets .

' [I]72-god greet [you]2643-you , [[my]72-god good friends]808-my good friends , [I]72-god think [I]72-god have said enough today , let [us]2642-we spend the rest of the day in mutual enjoyment . '[72-god]

And so [we]2642-we made merry until nightfall : there remained

trees and diverted [ourselves]2642-we in a hundred ways . In the

was left , for [we]2642-we had gone through the other six in the six

[a King]777-a king is [the Omnipotent One]2675-the omnipotent one . ' There was [a king]777-a king , and [a very powerful one]3052-a very powerful one ; [he]777-a king was rich ,[777-a king]

choir]2680-the 131 choir was singing in [church]2681-church and [the organist]2682-the organist revelling in [his]777-a king

to [the open grounds in front of [the Court which had been

[he]2811-the king who ordered that we be taken to the open grounds in front of the court which had been lit up with myriad lights and was bright as daylight sent the following gifts to [[our]2801-we king]956-our king : six diamond rings ,

six gold chains , six beaded crowns , six velvet cushions , six

household ornaments , and six bibles in six different languages .

And , in addition , [he]2811-the king who ordered that we be taken to the open grounds in front of the court which had been lit up with myriad lights and was bright as daylight gave [us]2801-we a letter which was written in a

mixture of liquid gold and silver to deliver to [the king]381-the king , and these were the contents of the letter :

Seventh Month in the Year Nineteen Hundred and Thirty

Three after the Death of [[Our]2801-we Lord]2805-our lord .

To [the King of [the Nation]2818-the nation of [these following brave

men]2819-these following brave men]2817-the king of the nation of these following brave men — [Kako]89-kako , [Imodoye]92-imodoye , [Akara - ogun]61-akara - ogun , [Elegbede - Ode]95-elegbede , Efoiye ,

[Aramada - okunrin]98-aramada - okunrin . [[Your]2820-you Emissaries]2821-your emissaries arrived [here]693-here in good health , [we]2801-we

rejoiced greatly when [we]2801-we saw [them]2821-your emissaries . [I]0-i send [you]2820-you some small gifts in sixes , as is the custom of [the Yoruba]1675-the yoruba in

days gone by and at other times even in the present age ;

[I]0-i do this as [a king who , with the symbol of six , seeks to

draw [you]2820-you closer in [my]0-i affection]2824-a king who , with the symbol of six , seeks to draw you closer in my affection . [My]0-i counsel about the

progress of [[your]2820-you land]2825-your land is this , let [the people of [[your]2820-you land]2825-your land]2826-the people of your land

love [one another]612-one another that [they]2826-the people of your land may value self - respect . If [they]2826-the people of your land

hold dear the dignity of [[their]2826-the people of your land persons]2829-their persons [they]2826-the people of your land will not

thieve , [they]2826-the people of your land will not gossip , [they]2826-the people of your land will not be false , [they]2826-the people of your land

will not be disobedient , [they]2826-the people of your land will not be arrogant ; [the

children]1954-the children will hold [[their]1954-the children elders]2137-their elders in honour , [the elders]2491-the elders will

look after youth , there will not be found one blame - worthy trait among [them]2491-the elders ; and [they]2491-the elders will love [God]72-god and love

[you]2820-you also .

Give [my]0-i good wishes to [[your]2820-you people]2833-your people .

[I]0-i am , [Yours]2820-you in truth ,

[The King of [Mount Langbodo]97-mount langbodo]2810-the king of mount langbodo . '[2810-the king of mount langbodo]

[We]2835-our slept at [the palace]893-the palace till daybreak , and in the morning of the following day [the king]381-the king made [us]2835-our gifts of many things ,

and [we]2835-our turned [our]2835-our feet into [the road]472-the road , headed for [[our]2835-our home]1321-our home . [I]0-i will not tell [you]2820-you of the various adventures of [our]2835-our return

journey for they are too numerous . Doubtless it will sadden

[you]2820-you to learn that it was [not all who set out from [Mount Langbodo]97-mount langbodo who returned to [[our]2835-our homes]1664-our homes]2840-not all who set out from mount langbodo who returned to our homes . And how did it happen thus ? Many perished through simple conceit . [The dupe of [the

world]206-the world]2842-the dupe of the world is [the conceited man]2844-the conceited man ; [he]2844-the conceited man thinks that only when [he]2844-the conceited man

struts and shows off does [the world]206-the world respect [him]2844-the conceited man , [he]2844-the conceited man little dreams that this is the very time that humiliation will reduce [him]2844-the conceited man . If

[a man]259-a man overreaches [himself]259-a man , [he]259-a man crashes to the ground ; if [a

house]814-a house is overweening , it soon disintegrates ; if [a town]975-a town is

vainglorious , quickly will its disruption occur ; if [a nation]2849-a nation

is self - satisfied it will soon enough become enslaved to another ;

if [a powerful government]2850-a powerful government preens itself , before a bird 's touch-

down [[its]2850-a powerful government peoples]2851-its peoples will disperse before [its]2850-a powerful government very eyes . When [the delegates of [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo]2852-the delegates of mount langbodo were smitten with this

arrogance , [they]2852-the delegates of mount langbodo listened no longer to the suggestions of [others]379-others ,

amity had fled [them]2852-the delegates of mount langbodo and [everyone]883-everyone behaved as [he]883-everyone wished .

But according to the habit of [[our]2855-we Creator]2650-our creator , [He]2650-our creator employs two methods to punish [the sinner]2857-the sinner , either [He]2650-our creator punishes [him]2857-the sinner imme- diately or [He]2650-our creator notes down [his]2650-our creator sins in the record book . But

with [these men]960-these men [He]2650-our creator did not adopt the latter method — instant

was [their]960-these men punishment . When [we]2855-we got to [the river of blood]1863-the river of blood , [we]2855-we met [the ghommids]373-the ghommids at play , for that was the day on which

[Olokun]142-olokun who is [the guardian spirit of water]2861-the guardian spirit of water celebrates [his]2650-our creator

festival . [Kako]89-kako went to [these ghommids]530-these ghommids and began to play

with [them]530-these ghommids ; [we]2855-we warned [him]89-kako but [he]89-kako would not heed [us]2855-we . After

a while [the ghommids]373-the ghommids went down to the bed of [this river of

blood]2864-this river of 138 blood and [Kako]89-kako followed [them]373-the ghommids . To this day [we]2855-we have heard

no news of [him]89-kako . [Efoiye]96-efoiye and [Elegbede - Ode]95-elegbede said that [they]2865-they

wanted to do a little hunting ; [they]2865-they became ghommids in [the

forest]201-the forest and [we]2855-we never saw [them]2865-they again . And , when [we]2855-we got to

[the seven wailing women]2867-the seven wailing women , [Aramada - okunrin]98-aramada - okunrin sat by [them]2867-the seven wailing women and declared that [he]98-aramada - okunrin would not continue with [us]2855-we , but [Imodoye]92-imodoye , [Olohun - iyo]94-olohun - iyo and [1]565-1 returned [home]199-home safe and sound , and [we]2855-we gave thanks to [God]72-god . were dead , and [those who remained]2871-those who remained did not even remember [us]2855-we

for [we]2855-we had been gone a long time . When [we]2855-we came to [the king]381-the king

[he]381-the king had aged a lot , [his]381-the king sight was uncertain but , when [he]381-the king remem- bered who [we]2855-we were and [we]2855-we showed [him]381-the king the gifts and the

and from that day of [our]2855-we return [we]2855-we became [men of means]2874-men of means .

And thus ends the story of [our]2855-we journey to [Mount Langbodo]23-mount langbodo . [[My]0-i friends]180-my friends , herein ends all that [I]0-i mean to tell [the world]206-the world

at this time . [I]0-i want [you]180-my friends to use this story as a mine of wisdom that [your]180-my friends lives may be good . And so , fare [you]180-my friends well , [the native]2877-the native

returns to [[his]2877-the native dwelling]2878-his dwelling .
